Rather, here you’ll find hulking brutes of men throttling the unholy life from demons with their bare hands, voluptuous pirate women slicing foes to ribbons with rapiers as razor-sharp as their wits, dark wizards who become just a little less human with every spell they cast, and monsters from the darkest bowels of Hell and beyond. This isn’t Lord of the Rings or Harry Potter. This is Conan and Lankhmar.

93202.name: Maurice Sendak's Little Bear Adventure Game
93202.description:
Little Bear is having a picnic, and each player needs to find Little Bear's friends to bring them to the picnic. Whoever returns with the most friends wins the game. The friends are represented by cards.

Each player moves along a path on the board. When landing on a colored acorn space, you pick up the top card on the draw or discard pile. If it matches the color you are on, you keep the card. If not, you discard the card, face down.

When landing on a Little Bear space, you take a card and keep it, regardless of color. There are also "lose a card" spaces where you lose a card of your choosing to the discard pile.

When all players reach the end (Little Bear's house), the winner is the player with the most cards.

93203.name: You Cards
rpgcategory: Non-Rankable Item (item will not show in the rankings)
93203.description:
From the Webpage
These cards were made to add some variety to YOU: The Role-Playing Game of Tomorrow. Be sure to read the rules to that game before you make these cards.

93204.name: Aadu Puli Attam
93204.description:
Aadu Puli Attam (goat and tiger game) is a strategic, two-player (or 2 teams) board game that's played in Tamil Nadu and Andhra Pradesh at India. The game is asymmetric in that one player controls three tigers and the other player controls up to 15 goats. The tigers 'hunt' the goats while the goats attempt to block the tigers' movements.

At the start of the game all the 3 Pulis (tigers) are placed on the apex, and 2 inner places closest to the apex. All aadus (goats) start off the board.

The pieces must be put at the intersections of the board lines and moves follow these lines.

Aadu's objective is to encircle Pulis so that none of the Pulis can move. Puli's objective is to kill All Aadus.

Equipment:
Aadu: 15 small pieces.
Puli: 3 big pieces.
Board with lines and 23 Spots for moving Aadu and Pulis.

93205.name: Monsters Vs Aliens
93205.description:
Players take control of B.O.B., Missing Link, Dr. Cockroach PHD, and Ginormica/Susan Murphy in all platforms plus Insectosaurus on the Nintendo DS version of the game. Each level is divided into multiple stages in which the player takes control of each monster's unique abilities to fight off enemies. The Missing Link can stick to the sides of large robotic bosses, take control of missal turrets, and agilely outwit his opponents with superior acrobatic skills, B.O.B. will have to solve complex one step at a time 3-D mazes, can turn floating plasma generators into personal Turrets, slide through grates and use enemies as living Key cards/ammunition, Dr. Cockroach serves as a secondary co-op player to B.O.B. or The Missing Link with new abilities such as the tractor beam being purchased in the DNA lab, and finally Ginormica will use cars, Jeeps and hover platforms as roller skates to dash, Kick, Jump, and Duck through enemies and fight all bosses to devastate enemies. The music was composed by Jim Dooley, with live brass recorded at the Warner Brothers Eastwood Scoring Stage.

Source: Wikipedia, "Monsters vs. Aliens (video game)", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

93206.name: x6 Core Rules
93206.description:
Website Description
This contains the basic rules and mechanics used by the x6 system, as well as a sample set of character abilities and a small selection of weapons and armour designed for a contemporary game setting. Future expansions are going to build on this set of rules.

93207.name: Alxemy
93207.description:
User Summary

In Alxemy you add fauna and flora to a world by combining elements. You start out with just a few possible combinations, but as you find more elements the possible combinations increase. There is a list of elements you can create with your elements and a tutor who give you hints when you are stuck for a while.

This game is based on an old DOS game "Alchemy". Another Alchemy's descendant is Doodle God.

93208.name: LEGO Pirates of the Caribbean: The Video Game
videogamehonor: 2012 British Academy Game Awards Best Family/Children's Game of the Year Nominee
93208.description:
Join Jack Sparrow and experience the Pirates of the Caribbean universe like never before with the humorous twist that only LEGO can provide.

Experience the swashbuckling adventure, irrevent humor, memorable characters and amazing creatures of the Pirates of the Caribbean universe (content from all 4 films), through action adventure gameplay, engaging puzzles and hilarlously quirkly LEGO cutscenes.

Play as Jack Sparrow, Captain Barbossa, Davy Jones and all of your other favorite Pirates of the Caribbean characters, each with their own personalities!

Experience your favorie sequences from all your PotC films in an all-new way with the 'LEGO twist' that takes players from the port of San Juan to the pirate haven of Tortugaand everywhere in-between!

Local co-op play, one of the most beloved features of the LEGO videogame series, returns to allow you to team up and enjoy the adventure with others!

Master the fun of swordmanship and take the action to a whole new level!

Replay the story levels as different characters in Free-Play Mode, and search for new areas to explore, new character puzzles to solve and even buried.

Source: The Publisher Website.

93209.name: Chronos Twins
93209.description:
The player takes on the role of a member of the Llhedar species, who, because of their psychic abilities and the fact that they never give up until the goal is complete, are well suited for missions such as those in this game. The primary mission of the game is to free the planet Skyla from an alien invasion and the powerful entity known as "Twime." Little is known about Twime; she seems indestructible because of her ability to exist simultaneously in two different times. The player is able to teletransport between the two times by using the "Dual Time," a machine created by the sages of Skyla, the Wise. A secondary objective of the game is to avenge the main character's brother, Nash.

Source: Wikipedia, "Chronos Twin", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

93210.name: Face Off
93210.description:
Abstract strategy game with the game board of woman's face.
Game involves moving pieces off the face and onto the outer squares. You can move Your piece 1 step to any direction including diagonally or leap-frog it over other game pieces to make huge advances towards your final destination.
Player who gets his pieces off the face first is the winner.

93211.name: The Sarkorian Prophecy
93211.description:
Publisher blurb (from website):

When a novice Pathfinder in the Grand Lodge of Absalom discovers an account of a long lost prophecy which may hold the key to defeating the Shadow Lodge, a team of brave agents heads into the heart of the Worldwound to recover the document. Not only do the forces of the Abyss and the demon-tainted environment stand in their way, but so does a rival team of Pathfinders set on recovering the Sarkorian Prophecy first.

This product is a Pathfinder Society Scenario designed for 7th to 11th level characters (Tiers: 7–8 and 10–11). This scenario is designed for play in Pathfinder Society Organized Play, but can easily be adapted for use with any world. This scenario is compliant with the Open Game License (OGL) and is suitable for use with the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game.

93212.name: Mean Streets
93212.description:
From publisher blurb:

Mean Streets takes the best (and bleakest) aspects of film noir, presenting them in a concept with which to role-play cynical private eyes, unscrupulous gangsters, and dangerous femme fatales as portrayed in film noir from the '40s and better part of the '50s.

This complete game contains everything you'll need to role play your favorite film noir! From character archetypes to maps to a comprehensive GM section, it's all here in one place.

Mean Streets runs on the XPG system, simple roleplaying rules that are unobtrusive and easy to learn, even for the novice player. The same system that is running the Red Dwarf™ roleplaying game to great effect!

93213.name: Vendetta: A Gangland Resource
rpghonor: 2002 Indie RPG Awards - Best Supplement - Runner Up
93213.description:
From publisher blurb:

Vendetta: A Gangland Resource is the first supplement in support of Deep7's role-playing game of classic film noir, Mean Streets. In this supplement, players and GMs are treated to a more detailed look into organized crime in America, its roots, founding fathers and families, and puts it all into perspective for those who want to play mobsters and hooligans in a crime/gangster-based campaign.

93214.name: Dark Companion
93214.description:
From publisher blurb:

This definitive player's and GM's resource for Mean Streets contains new skills, assets, liabilities, character archetypes and behavior tags, as well as additional weapons and vehicles of the 1940s. As a GM's guide, the Dark Companion has fully developed NPCs, ready-made locations and popular "hot spots" to flesh out a campaign setting, adventures seeds and much more.

93215.name: Bob, Lord of Evil Character Sheet 1
93215.description:
User Summary

A character sheet with a Base Action Value table for the Bob, Lord of Evil game.

93216.name: Usual Suspects
93216.description:
From publisher blurb:

The definitive NPC resource for Mean Streets. Includes a stable of film noir characters perfect for use in a campaign, or to play yourself. By some of the biggest hacks in the biz: Bernstein, Bruno, Downing, Kenrick, Norris and Stubbs.

93217.name: Spielwelt (Issue 32 - Oct 1987)
rpgpublisher: Club für Fantasy- und Simulationsspiele e.V.
93217.description:
(user summary)

table of content:

Im Blickpunkt - news
Spielebasar - game reviews
Das Schwarzdorn-Rätsel - CoC scenario
Fantasy-Almanach - on beggars in the middleages
Aus den Kellern unserer Städte - on city adventures
Stadtbummel - cities in diverse RPGs
Der Geist im Weine - scenario for D&D/Midgard/DSA
Palaver - on free roleplaying
Bücherwurm - book reviews

93218.name: Modus Operandi
93218.description:
From publisher blurb:

Take the law into your own hands in this law enforcement resource for Mean Streets! This indespensable noir sourcebook covers police procedure and criminal law in pre-Miranda Rights America, with methods of incorporating cops, detectives, and elements of courtroom drama (a film noir staple) into your campaigns.

93219.name: Concrete Jungle: The New York City Sourcebook
93219.description:
From publisher blurb:

Concrete Jungle is the first location sourcebook for Mean Streets: The RPG of Classic Film Noir. This guide to New York City will expound upon the information presented in the core book, delving deeper into the city's boroughs, its history, culture, people, government and law officials, politics, and, of course, the corruption that festers in the shadows. GMs will find a wealth of information with which to base a film noir campaign in the city that never sleeps.

93220.name: WarGames
93220.description:
WarGames is a 1984 video game developed by Coleco for the ColecoVision. The game's goal is to defend the United States against nuclear attack, much in the style of a less frantic "Missile Command". The principal designer was Coleco staffer Joseph Angiolillo.

The game was directly inspired by MGM's 1983 film "WarGames", but instead of depicting the film's events, adapts its iconic NORAD scene into playable form. It is one of a handful of games that feature waging nuclear war, and one of the few without an aim of winning it.

Source: Wikipedia, "WarGames (video game)", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

93221.name: Space Rangers
93221.description:
Plot
In Space Rangers, a relatively peaceful interstellar coalition is invaded by a powerful enemy; the organic warships of the Klissans. The player is a Ranger, one of a group of non-military volunteers who are given small ships, free rein and the task of helping to battle, understand and ultimately defeat the menace.

Gameplay
The game is dynamic and open-ended in a fashion that has been compared to Elite and Star Control 2.[2] Trade prices on planets follow supply and demand, the wars are ongoing non-scripted conflicts, computer-controlled ships have individual capabilities, goals and relations, etc. There are even several ways to complete the storyline. The games have turn-based space travel and combat, optional shoot 'em up sequences and occasional bits of text adventure.

Background
Long ago now wise and peaceful Gaal race was very aggressive and was creating a huge number of colonies. Due to large space distances it created hyperjumper which could make holes in the galaxy. Soon one of the colonies met with Klissan fleet. Although Gaal colony ships tried to communicate with Klissan ships they failed to do that and were destroyed. Soon Makhpella, the mothership of all Klissans and Klissan fleet invaded all outer Gaal colonies. Gaal colony fleet was completely helpless and in order to save original Gaal territories and Gaal motherland itself from invasion they decided not to jump back and make Makhpella trace the route there but to blow up the remaining other colonies using the hyperjumper.

Not very long ago everything was started by Peleng captain called Rachekhan who was one of commanders of Peleng fleet. He was thrown out of the fleet and became a pirate. Since he had an access to secret documents and weaponry he stole a hyperjumper. While travelling with it he met Makhpella. It considered Rachekhan's pirate fleet as an enemy and started chasing it. During the chase Rachekhan and Klissan fleets went through interstellar coalition sectors so Makhpella spotted IC sectors and now knew its location and identified all IC races as foes. So the war started.

Source: Wikipedia, "Space Rangers (video game)", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

93222.name: Pandora's Box
93222.description:
A timeless game of psychology and curiosity

To Hesiod and the Ancient Greeks, womanhood began with Pandora. Her very name meant she was gifted in every way by the gods: beautiful, wise, musical, persuasive, confident . . . and curious. She was given a jar that contained all of the world’s evils, and also one good spirit, Hope. In the end, she chose to open it, and set the course for humanity.

Pandora's Box provides a simple and deep abstract party game for a group of players to analyze how well they know the strategic planning of their friends. Each player receives a few white and black stones (good and evil spirits) that they drop into a box in the center of the play area. They may also switch the stones in their hands with other players throughout the game. When someone drops her last stone into Pandora's Box, the box is opened, its contents revealed and taken by the player who opened it, and each player scores points for white stones in hand and loses a point for black stones in hand.

Though it sounds incredibly simple, the game is fast, deep, thrilling, and offers tremendous psychological fun and unexpected results. Despite having no random elements, it has plenty of hidden information that makes each game play out differently.

Pandora’s Box is offered as an entry to the Thousand Year Game Design Challenge: http://www.thousandyeargame.com

93223.name: Space Rangers 2: Dominators
93223.description:
Space Rangers 2: Dominators, released in North America with the subtitle Rise of the Dominators, is a multi-genre science fiction computer game developed by Elemental Games for Windows and first published in 2004 by 1C Company. The player takes the role of a spaceship pilot, and may explore, trade, engage in space and ground based combat, and undertake various types of missions. Space Rangers 2 is the sequel to the 2002 computer game Space Rangers.

Plot
Space Rangers 2 is set in the year 3300. Sentient combat robots known as Dominators are attacking the five civilizations of the Coalition: the humans, the Maloqs, the Pelengs, the Faeyans, and the Gaalians. There are three Dominator types, each at war with each other: the Blazeroids, the Kelleroids, and the Terronoids. The player begins the game as a trainee member of the Space Rangers – a corps of pilots charged with defending the galaxy from the Dominators.

Gameplay
Space Rangers 2 combines multiple gameplay modes. Space travel takes place in a third-person perspective turn-based 2D engine. The game also includes a 3D real-time strategy engine for planetary battles, with the option to control units within the RTS engine to play the battles as third-person shooters. The game also features an arcade shoot 'em up mode, and text-based missions that include interactive fiction and logic puzzle elements. The player character can gain experience points and improve skills, and the player character's ship can be upgraded as the player earns more cash. Sources of income for the player character include trading, piracy, completing missions for various factions, mining, and deploying research probes.

Source: Wikipedia, "Space Rangers 2: Dominators", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

93224.name: Aspect Core Rulebook
93224.description:
from the publisher website

Pick up Aspect and start making your own legends.
Aspect is the culmination of 24 years of roleplaying game design and piles of handwritten notebooks and adventures distilled here so you can make every fantasy character you can imagine.

In these 256 pages, you will find:

* Arcane magic
* Divine authority
* Elemental control
* Martial prowess
* Supernatural pacts
* Custom pets and minions
* Artifice-making, and more

Don't be a cookie-cutter character! Mix and match 40 unique power sets with nine combat roles to be as flexible or focused as you want. Choose from the 16 gentle races and their unique powers or make your own hybrids. You can even use the monster races.

Aspect finally eliminates the 15-minute day. Never again will your players halt halfway through a rescue mission in order to go back to town and heal-unless you meant them to. There is not a single thing in this book that can only be done once per day. Everything is at-will, even healing!

Encounters are easy to set up as Aspect handles Physical, Social and Mental combat, each using the same mechanics.

This edition of Aspect includes:

* Tips for running an Aspect game
* Pages of magic items, rituals and skills
* Social interaction mechanics
* 70 challenging monsters
* Rules for making your own monsters (hint: it is just like making a character!)

Join the open beta playtest of Aspect and rekindle your enthusiasm for tabletop action-oriented fantasy adventures. And don't forget to join us on the forums to let your voice be heard!

93225.name: ABM
93225.description:
UNLICENSED GAME




This game is an unlicensed version of Missile Command.




The Russians are coming!!! Save the cities of Boston, New York, Philadelphia, Baltimore, Washington and Richmond from nuclear attack. You must destroy the enemy missiles in flight with your Anit-ballistic Missles fired from your bases between your cities. Your bases are "hardened" and can repair themselves to some extant after a nuclear strike - but your cities cannot.

93227.name: A.E.
93227.description:
From the instructions

The AE ("rays") were designed as pollution-fighting robots by a well-intentioned multi-national corporation. Intended to save the world, the AE slipped through quality control out into the unsuspecting universe. Now THEY are out of control!! While the fate of the Free World does not depend upon getting rid of the AE, they have become an unrelenting nuisance, much like motorcycle gangs or geese on the runway.

Only when you have pushed the AE all the way up and out of our corner of the cosmos will they finally leave us alone. We hope.

93229.name: Dragão Brasil  (Issue 41 - Aug 1998)
93229.description:
Table of Contents

2 - Bard's News
7 - Reader's Scroll
14 - Cards Rules for tournaments of Magic
18 - ABC of RPG
22 - Resident Evil for Vampire, GURPS and Daemon.
32 - Mortal Kombat 4 for GURPS

61 - Comics Capitão Ninja

93230.name: NARC (1988)
93230.description:
NARC is a 1988 arcade game designed by Eugene Jarvis for Williams Electronics programmed by George Petro. It was one of the first ultra-violent video games and a frequent target of parental criticism of the arcade game industry. The object is to arrest and kill drug offenders, confiscate their money and drugs, and defeat "Mr. Big". It was ported, not long after, to the NES and several home computer systems in 1990. In 2005, it was also updated into a brand new game for the Xbox and PS2.

Released in 1988, it was the first game in the newly restarted Williams Electronics coin op division, and features their notable use of digitized graphics (later made famous in games such as Mortal Kombat). In fact, the quality of the graphics in terms of number of colors would not be surpassed until the game Mortal Kombat II (released in 1993). The game features what in arcade terminology is termed a medium resolution monitor - higher resolution than televisions and normal arcade monitors, although often in a smaller physical size. NARC was also the very first arcade game to utilize the TI TMS34010, which is a 32-bit processor. The game was also notable for the numerous voice samples used during and between levels.

Source: Wikipedia, "NARC (video game)", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

93231.name: NARC (2005)
93231.description:
The 2005 home console update of the 1988 arcade hit of the same title was also developed and published by Midway Games for the Xbox and PS2. A planned Nintendo GameCube version was later canceled. Although the update was slated to be a straight remake of the story from the arcade game, the version that was eventually released featured a totally new story. Several well-known stars are involved with the voice acting in NARC, including Michael Madsen, Bill Bellamy, and Ron Perlman. The game's soundtrack features artists such as Curtis Mayfield, Cypress Hill, Grandmaster Flash, Lynyrd Skynyrd, and indie artists such as Point Game and Camden. The update casts the player as narcotics officer Jack Forzenski and DEA agent Marcus Hill, former partners reunited who are instructed to investigate a new drug on the streets called Liquid Soul.

One of the most controversial aspects of the game is that after arresting dealers and confiscating their stock, the player can either take the confiscated items to the evidence room, or keep them for future use. This confers benefits such as improved weapons accuracy. Dealing drugs for financial benefit is also possible. The integration of drug use by the protagonist is in complete contrast to the anti-drug message of the original arcade game. The game's source code (engine) dates back to the three-year-old State of Emergency.

Source: Wikipedia, "NARC (video game)", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

93232.name: MLB 09: The Show
videogamehonor: 2010 D.I.C.E. Sports Game of the Year Nominee
93232.description:
MLB 09: The Show is a baseball simulation video game developed by SCE San Diego Studio and published by Sony Computer Entertainment for the PlayStation 2, PlayStation 3, and PlayStation Portable systems. It belongs to the Major League Baseball game series on the PlayStation systems. MLB 09: The Show is the fourth edition of the MLB: The Show series.

The game is a baseball simulation in which, depending on the gameplay mode, the player controls one or all of the players on a Major League Baseball team or some select Minor League Baseball teams. Depending on the gameplay mode, the player may control a team for a single game, season, or franchise, and can also create a player and control his career.

Source: Wikipedia, "MLB 09: The Show", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

93233.name: Dragão Brasil  (Issue 40 - July 1998)
93233.description:

2 - Bard's News

12 - Especial Trinity vs. Alternity
16 - The Sorcerers Crusade

93234.name: Freddi Fish and the Case of the Missing Kelp Seeds
93234.description:
In this game, Grandma Grouper's treasure chest of kelp seeds are stolen, and Freddi and Luther go off in search of the thieves, who turn out to be two sharks (One is called Spongehead but the other is never called anything but Boss). Thankfully Spongehead has a bad memory so he left a trail of notes in bottles leading to the chest. This game, as well as its subsequent titles, won several awards upon release. It is now a Wii game, too, known as Freddi Fish in Kelp Seed Mystery.

Source: Wikipedia, "Freddi Fish", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

93235.name: Dragão Brasil  (Issue 38 - May 1998)

93236.name: Freddi Fish and Luther's Water Worries
93236.description:
User Summary

You play Luther, a young fish who is lost at sea. You must pass through 100 underwater levels filled with obstacles, dodging enemies and bubbles.

93237.name: Česko Junior
93237.description:
Česko trivia game now has a junior version. questions and answers for children from age 10.

On your turn, roll the die and move your playing piece as many steps as the die shows, to either direction. The space that your playing piece lands on shows from which category you will answer a question.
You must collect 1 correct answer from every category and after that there is one final question. To win the game You must answer this correctly.

93238.name: Česko: otázky a odpovědi (cestovní verze)
93238.description: Expansion to Česko (Czechia), questions and answers. Adds 600 questions/answers to the original game.

93239.name: Dragão Brasil  (Issue 37- Apr 1998)
rpg: Legend of the Five Rings (1st Edition)

2 - Bard's News
6 - Reader's Scroll
18 - ABC of RPG

14 - Kindred of the East for Vampire

93240.name: Slovensko
93240.description:
Slovensko (Slovakia), questions and answers is an entertaining trivia quiz game for curious Slovaks, where you will find 2400 interesting questions and answers about Slovakia.
Collect a token from each category to begin your winning journey to the center square.

On your turn, roll the die and move your playing piece as many steps as the die shows, to either direction. The space that your playing piece lands on shows from which category you will answer a question.
- If your answer is incorrect, or you don’t answer at all, your turn is over and the turn passes to the next player.
- If your answer is correct, you receive a category counter from the category you just answered.
Once you have answered correctly to one question in both spaces, you can move your playing piece to the Finish space,
answer one more question and if this answer right wint the game.
- If you have to answer a question from a category
for which you already have a puzzle piece, you
don't receive a second puzzle piece of that colour
if you answer correctly. Instead, you can throw the
dice again, move your token normally and answer
a new question. Continue this way until your answer
is incorrect or you receive a new puzzle piece. After
this the turn goes to the next player.
After collecting tokens form every category there is final questions. To win the game You must answer those correctly.

93241.name: Slovensko Junior
93241.description:
Junior version of the game Slovensko (Slovakia), questions and answers for children from age 10.

On your turn, roll the die and move your playing piece as many steps as the die shows, to either direction. The space that your playing piece lands on shows from which category you will answer a question.
You must collect 1 correct answer from every category and after that there is one final question. To win the game You must answer this correctly.

93242.name: Česko sport
93242.description: Expansion to Česko (Czechia), questions and answers. Adds 600 questions/answers about sport to the original game.

93244.name: The Awakening
93244.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Power to Remake the World

You were a normal person before you Awoke to the infinite possibilities of reality. Your life was turned upside down when you carved your secret name into the mystical Watchtower, but now you hold the power to remake the world, the power of true magic. The mysteries of the universe are unveiled before your eyes.

You are a mage now. You can do anything.

And you are not alone.

Provides everything you need for a Mind's Eye Theatre chronicle set in the popular Mage: The Awakening setting
Expanded political mechanics and revised spellcasting systems designed for the unique aspects of live-action roleplay
A variety of optional rules and Storyteller advice to help develop your chronicle the way you envision it
For use with the Mind's Eye Theatre Rulebook

93245.name: Sly Flourish's Running Epic Tier D&D Games
93245.description:
From the Author's Website:

Running epic tier D&D games is no easy task. Your players demand more from your story. They require a challenge far beyond the gnolls and orcs you've been throwing at them thus far. They carry enough firepower to burn a hole through a Tarrasque and chain-stun Vecna until his other eye pops out. Running epic games is hard but this book is here to help.

Sly Flourish's Running Epic Tier D&D Games is your guide to running fast, fun, and challenging epic tier adventures. You'll learn how to build epic stories, deal with the power of epic tier PCs, and keep your group always coming back for more.

This is a short book (52 pages in PDF, 70 pages in print) designed to get you right into the tips and topics that will help you run a great epic tier D&D game.

93246.name: Dragão Brasil  (Issue 35 - Feb 1998)

64 - Interview Marcelo Campos

93247.name: JellyCar
93247.description:
JellyCar is a driving/platforming game for both Windows and Xbox360 [and now iPhone]. The game is about driving a squishy car through squishy worlds, trying to reach the exit. The game features soft body physics for all of the objects in the world. Also your car can transform for a limited time to aid progression through the level.

Source: The Developer Website.

93248.name: JellyCar 2
93248.description:
User Summary

Sequel to the original JellyCar. iPad edition comes with all new Two Player Modes, redesigned Custom Level Editor and optimized graphics.

93249.name: JellyCar 3
93249.description:
Greatly improved third installment in the JellyCar series.


Greatly improved controls, camera, presentation
New levels with more interactive elements
Improved car customization (color in your car with crayons and markers)
Full replay system - watch gameplay playback, save and watch later.
Flipbook export! export replay data to a PDF that you can print and make a physical flipbook!
Custom sound effects - record your own sounds using the device microphone
Leaderboards with ghost replays - race your friends
Universal Binary + Retina Display support
GameCenter achievements


Source: The Developer Website.

93250.name: Crystal Soul
93250.description:
User Summary

A combination of RPG and puzzle game. You must protect your kingdom by defeating crystal monsters. By doing so you can build up your character (one of three types) and move on to the next big monster.

93251.name: Hungry Shark - Part 1
93251.description:
User Summary

You are a hungry shark! Swim through the ocean in this side-scrolling adventure and eat fish in the sea, birds in the air, and all manner of other delectable animals.

93252.name: Hungry Shark - Part 2
93252.description:
Chomp your way to the top of the food chain in this fast-paced aquatic eat 'em-up. Binge on the beach, trawl the depths and raid the Antarctic to satisfy your voracious appetite. Pick-up-and-play fun with beat-your-buddies online hi-scores. Feeling peckish?

Source: The Developer Website.

93253.name: Hungry Shark - Part 3
93253.description:
Hungry Shark Part3 is the Super addictive sequel to the top selling iPhone game.

Part 3 contains an underwater volcano complete with an evil genius' secret lair, Enemy Sharks, Massive Oil Rigs, Underwater Oil Slicks, Shark Finners, the mythical Kempy Bass plus more than 20 other new creature types to feast upon.

Game features:
- Full HD support for Retina displays
- More than 25 new types of food and enemies
- Massive all new game world
- Full use of Tilt controls + alternate touch controls
- Combo eating bonuses
- Lost objects from the world above, find them all for big points
- Hiscore tables: Private and Global, Last 24hrs, Your Country
- Unlock achievements by completing 20 challenges!
- Game Center support - show off your achievements and leaderboard scores to other Game Center friends!

Source: The Developer Website.

93254.name: Hungry Shark Trilogy HD
93254.description:
Hungry Shark Trilogy contains both iPhone Parts & the brand new Part 3, all in Glorious HD! Hook it up to your HD TV for the full console experience!

Source: The Developer Website.

93255.name: Super Action Baseball
93255.description:
From the Instruction Booklet:

Get ready for the thrill of major league baseball. Your SUPER ACTION Controllers put the game right at your fingertips. Up at bat, you can hit anything from a grounder to a homer. Your pitcher throws fast balls, curves, sliders - everything short of ye olde spitball! Fielders snag the ball, throw to first or tag the man out. You can even make double plays! You do it "ALL" in SUPER ACTION Baseball!

93257.description:
The Gleaming Spiral is the fifth Asylum Pack in the Rituals of the Order cycle for Call of Cthulhu: The Card Game. Lucy sees the horrifying consequences of learning secrets that are best left alone as she witnesses the fate of Dr. Cooke.

The Gleaming Spiral is a fixed 60 card Asylum Pack that contains 20 different never-before-seen cards based on the dark mythos of master horror writer H.P. Lovecraft, designed to augment existing decks and add variety to the Call of Cthulhu metagame.
93257.name: Call of Cthulhu: The Card Game – The Gleaming Spiral Asylum Pack
boardgamefamily: Call of Cthulhu: The Card Game (LCG)

93258.name: The Farming Game Card Game
93258.description:
In the Farming Game Card Game, you're a wannabe farmer.
You get to bid for crops, plant them, harvest them and try it all again.

Bid for the right to plant crops, roll the dice to see how well your crops did. At game end, total cash + total crop value = your score.

Game Play: Each turn consists of 4 phases.
1. Read a farmer's fate card (this card is the same for all players but will affect each player differently depending on their individual crops)
2. Bid for and purchase crops (borrowing money if necessary)
3. If you have money left over, buy crop enhancements (fertilized, grass fed, organic)
4. Harvest your crops (roll the dice to determine how well your crops performed)

Each turn can take 5-10 minutes and the number of turns is determined by the players at the start of the game. A minimum game is usually 3 turns.

By the end of the game, you want to have the highest total value after paying off all debts.

93259.name: Wii Remote
93259.description:
The Wii Remote, sometimes unofficially nicknamed "Wiimote", is the primary controller for Nintendo's Wii console. A main feature of the Wii Remote is its motion sensing capability, which allows the user to interact with and manipulate items on screen via gesture recognition and pointing through the use of accelerometer and optical sensor technology. Another feature is its expandability through the use of attachments. The attachment bundled with the Wii console is the Nunchuk, which complements the Wii Remote by providing functions similar to those in gamepad controllers. Some other attachments include the Wii Classic Controller, Wii Zapper, and the Wii Wheel, originally used for Mario Kart.

The controller was revealed at the Tokyo Game Show on October 14, 2005, with the name "Wii Remote" announced April 27, 2006. It has since received much attention due to its unique features and the contrast between it and typical gaming controllers. It has also gained significant attention from hackers using it to control non Wii-related devices through Wii homebrew.

Source: Wikipedia, "Wii Remote", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

boardgameintegration: Summoner Wars: Guild Dwarves vs Cave Goblins
Summoner Wars: Phoenix Elves vs Tundra Orcs
Summoner Wars: Guild Dwarves vs Cave Goblins
Summoner Wars: Phoenix Elves vs Tundra Orcs
boardgamehonor: 2012 Golden Geek Best 2-Player Board Game Nominee
2012 Golden Geek Best Card Game Nominee
2012 International Gamers Award - General Strategy: Two-players Nominee
93260.description:
Summoner Wars is a fast-playing, action-packed card game for 2-4 players in which they take on the role of Summoners: powerful beings who harness the power of mysterious Summoning Stones to lead their race to conquest on the war-torn planet of Itharia. These Summoners wield terrible magic on the battlefield, freezing their foes in place, draining their enemies of power, and even bringing rains of fire down from the heavens. But most notoriously, they summon their great race's hordes of warriors to the battlefield, to clash in the never-ending struggle for supremacy. A Summoner is both mage and general, and must combine their wizardly might with clever tactics to defeat the enemy Summoner on the opposite side of the battle.

The Summoner Wars Master Set contains six new and different complete factions from which to choose:

• Play as the Shadow Elves and conceal your plans in swirling darkness!
• Choose the Benders and confound your foe, turning his own troops against him!
• Command the Vargath, mountainous goatfolk who call lightning from the heavens!
• Select the nefarious Sand Goblins and delight in malicious trickery!
• Muster the Deep Dwarves and control the forces of Geomancy!
• Lead the ferocious Swamp Orcs to war and hack upon your foes as they are snared in your vines!

Strategy shapes the composition of each deck of cards and how they are used. Tactics determine the effectiveness of those cards in battle. Call walls of stone to protect you in combat and serve as magic portals for you to summon your warriors. Call your forces forth and send them in a surging wave against your enemy. Cast spells that bolster your forces and cut down those who would oppose you.

Victory can come only from the death of your opponent's Summoner...
93260.name: Summoner Wars: Master Set
boardgamepodcastepisode: BGA Ep. 40 - Thunder Alley
EP9：你就是我的master么？
Episode 1 - Mercenaries
Episode 10 - Cave Goblins
Episode 10.5 - Pre-GenCon
Episode 11 - Fallen Kingdom Second Summoner (Mad Sirian)
Episode 12 - Vanguards Second Summoner (Samuel Farthen)
Episode 13 - Tundra Orcs - Grognack Base Deck
Episode 14 - Tundra Orcs - Torgan Base Deck
Episode 15 - Tundra Orcs - Reinforcements & Deck Building

Episode 17 - Phoenix Elves - Queen Maldaria Base Deck
Episode 18 - Phoenix Elves - Reinforcements & Deck Building
Episode 2 - Movement Manipulation
Episode 3 - The Filth

Episode 5 - Listener Questions
Episode 6 - Fallen Kingdom
Episode 7 - Wall Placement & Strategies

Episode 9 - Second Summoners (Queen Maldaria, Torgan, Bolvi, Frick)
The Dice Section 9: Summoner Wars iOS
The Good, The Board and The Guru:  Episode 42 “Trent’s Top 10″
What Did You Play This Week Podcast Thing Week 21!!!

93261.name: Your World: 5 Games About You and Your World
93261.description:
Your World is a five-game compendium designed to help a child explore different aspects of their world. The games come in a boardbook format, with each two-page spread opening into a different game board. The games included are:

Who's Who? A Family Tree Game
In the House: A Room-By-Room Search Game
Uptown, Downtown: A Community Game of People and Places
All Around the World: A Game of Countries and Cultures
Space Race! A Space Exploration Game

Each of the five games are spin-and-move, and the rules of each require players to perform an action or answer a question on the topic when they land on certain spaces. The object of the game is to complete the circuit and reach the finish space before any other player.

93262.name: Ahnkar-Kosh, The Unstoppable
93262.description:
From the publisher:
The Coliseum Morpheuon is a dangerous place, but it is a whole lot safer for anyone standing behind this guy.

Available for hire in the Tarnished Souk, The Unstoppable is a walking wall, a one-manimal impenetrable sphere - the bodyguard of dreams, hired to protect folks from their worst nightmares. And in Dream, there are nightmares a-plenty.

Complete stat blocks for Ahnkar-Kosh, The Unstoppable are presented at Low, Medium and High challenge ratings, Also included are his powerful and unique magical items, amazing bodyguarding abilities (templates), and a helmet-full of ideas about how to responsibly use this devastating force of nature.

Protect your favorite NPC with The Unstoppable, and your players might just have to roleplay this one out.

Within this product you will find examples of Ahnkar-Kosh, The Unstoppable as:


CR 21 Male dreadnaught protector quickling manimal ankylosaurus armiger 8
CR 14 Male protector quickling manimal ankylosaurus fighter 5
CR 7 Male manimal ankylosaurus

93263.name: The Bible Says... TIS SO
93263.description:
From the box: Tis Tru - The Game of Bible Truths. A fun way to learn proverbs by matching scriptures.

The game consists of a spinner, 60 "Bible truths" (3 sections each), 9 blank sections, 6 "Book of life" sections and a list of "Bible truths".
Each "Bible truth" is broken up into a beginning, center and ending section. Players take turns spinning the spinner and collecting a number of face down sections from the center pile (Playing Pool) in an attempt to complete matching sets. Sections that you can use go in front of you face up and the ones you can't use right away go to a face up "Waiting Pool" that can be drawn from by all players.
When a player completes a "Bible truth" he gains the points listed on it.
The winner is the player that has the most points when all sections are drawn from both pools.

93264.name: Richelieu's Guide to the Church
93264.description:
Publisher Blurb

In a France troubled by demons, the Church has a greater role to play than many realize. This supplement takes a look at playing Church characters within the All for One setting. Inside you will find brief notes on church buildings and monastic orders, three new secret societies, four new NPC church characters, advice on running church-based campaigns, three sample characters, and a page of new sample lackeys. This product is not a detailed study of the Catholic Church, its beliefs, or its many offices.

93265.name: Richelieu's Guide to Radicals
93265.description:
Publisher Blurb

"Liberté, égalité, fraternité!" While it will be more than a century before those words echo across France and the nobility lose their heads, the seeds of dissension have already fallen upon fertile ground. This supplement explores anarchists, republicans, reformists, and other dissenters in the All for One RPG setting.

Inside you will find guidelines on playing a radical, four new secret societies, three sample player characters, and a host of revolutionary lackeys.

93266.name: The Havering Adventures
93266.description:
Publisher Blurb

Suave. Sophisticated. And deadly... Meet the Haverings, Victoriana's most infamous family: Nathaniel, head of the family and proof that the upper classes aren't always in charge; beautiful and decadent Susanna, Nathaniel's distinctly improper wife; Jonathan, fallen to terrible vice; Selina, a survivor from the gutter and the family's moral heart; Tobin, wizardly academic with a criminal side; and Patterson, because every now and then a gentleman needs a manservant to put the boot in...

Havering Adventures provides full statistics for the Haverings, for use either as player characters or NPCs, and three action-packed ready-to-play adventures showcasing the Haverings' unique talents.

93267.name: The New York Times Crosswords
93267.description:
Write in your own answers on the Touch Screen or use the Touch Screen keyboard to enter your answers. Complete more than 1,000 puzzles across Puzzle Me Quick!, Puzzle Week, or Crosswords. Challenge mode which includes time and difficulty settings you can adjust to your liking. Compete against up to three friends in a wireless multiplayer VS match or work together to fill in clues in 4-player cooperative play. Experience multiple visual themes as you complete puzzles. Take advantage of special functions including Hint (fills in a letter of a word you can’t figure out) and Undo (remove a letter you’ve placed incorrectly).

Source: The Publisher Website.

93268.name: Art Academy
93268.description:
Take lessons with an in-game tutor on basic sketching techniques, color mixing, and much more -- all with realistic effects that simulate a real-life painting experience. Ever wanted to get away from dry art school lectures, or the mess and hassle of canvas painting? With the Art Academy software, you can make your artistic ideas come to life wherever and whenever the inspiration strikes you.

Source: The Publisher Website.

93269.name: Let's Pilates
93269.description:
Pilates is a body conditioning routine that focuses on building flexibility, strength, endurance, and coordination without adding muscle bulk. Pilates increases circulation and helps to sculpt the body and strengthen the body's "core" or "powerhouse" (torso). People who do Pilates regularly feel they have better posture, are less prone to injury, and experience better overall health. Now you can learn how to do Pilates, or keep up with your training wherever you go. Let’s Pilates is the first Pilates instructional software available for the Nintendo DS, and it's a treasure-trove of knowledge whether you’ve been doing Pilates for five years or five minutes. Best of all, with Let’s Pilates, you can train anywhere, anytime, without needing to be in class or in front of your TV.

Source: The Publisher Website.

93270.name: Let's Yoga
93270.description:
Yoga is a full-scale instructional game for the Nintendo DS that helps you take advantage of yoga in your everyday routine. Learn how to perform poses and breathing techniques to improve your mood, deal with everyday stress, and enjoy your life more. With detailed and easy-to-understand instructions and videos for up to 80 poses, including many you can do at your desk, Let's Yoga is truly a portable and effective fitness solution.

Source: The Publisher Website.

boardgamepublisher: Copag - Cia. Paulista de Artes Gráficas
93271.description:
In CONVOCADOS (Drafted), players (coaches) compete to form the best football line up and win the duel.
Each coach have in front of him 3 main sections of the field: DEFENCE, MIDFIELD and ATTACK
The coach who win 2 sections is consider the winner, and to do so, he will have to draft and put on the field the best players.

You can choose between 2 formations you recieve in the beginning of the duel (4-4-2, 3-5-2, 4-3-3, 3-4-3). That means that if you choose 4-4-2, you'll be able to line up 4 Defenders, 4 Midfielders and 2 Forwarders.

Each player have three points assigneds, depending where (sector) you line him up, he will contribute with different points.
The game comes with 8 great national teams: Brazil, Argentina, Italy, Germany, Holland, Spain, France and Uruguay, and the players have points accordingly to his country historical ways of playing.

In this easy-to-learn card game, decisions happen all the time, tactical cards such as the "Richard the octopus" or "injury" can change the game strategy in just a second!!!

Who will you draft for yout team?
93271.name: Convocados

93272.name: Barbskin Demon
93272.description:
Publisher Blurb

This Freakshow presents the Barbskin Demon, a supernatural powerhouse of destruction. It is statted for Blood! and for two leading OGL systems (Modern and Runic).

93274.name: The Road to the White House
93274.description:
Candidates begin their campaign on the inner Resource loop of the board, gathering resources to be able to win individual state Electoral Votes on the outer loops of the board. A die (considered the Campaign Manager) is rolled to move the game piece. Most spaces on the board result in answering a political history trivia question to win resource points or electoral college votes. The winner is the first candidate to reach an Electoral College majority.

Pieces are provided for four candidates. More can be added. Six can be tracked on the Electoral Ballet card. If four or more players are involved, teams of two can be created as candidate and running mate. Rules variations are also included for teams and a short game.

The game was commissioned by Ford Motor Company national Public Affairs which owns the copyright. The game was intended as an entertaining and educational lead-up to the 1988 presidential election. It was conceived, designed and produced by Braddock Communications, Inc.

93275.name: Conquian
boardgamefamily: Card Games: Draw and Discard Games
93275.description:
A rummy-type of card game played with a Spanish/Latino deck or a modified standard 52-card deck (8s, 9s and 10s removed).

A wikipedia entry describes the potential of Conquian as being the oldest or amongst the oldest of rummy-type games.

A version of the game includes dealing 7 or 8 cards to each player in a 4-player game or 9 cards in 3- or 2-player game (or 8 cards for a 2 player game). The object is to win by playing runs of 3 or more, 3 or 4 of a kind, or melds (or watching players having to meld) to your tableau (the winner's tableau must be the amount of the initial hand + 1 more card) and running out of cards in your hand.

The active player may use the the obligatory drawn card to lay down a run or 3+ of a kind. Your tableau may be arranged in to different melds or runs to accommodate new arrangements. When a set or multiple sets are laid a card must be discarded. If a card is passed, then next player clockwise and likewise is able to utilize the card. If during the same turn someone utilizes the discards (thus laying down sets and ending with another discard) then the process repeats. If no one has won, then the next player clockwise from the current active player continues with a draw.

Any cards melded to another player's tableau allow the opposing player to discard a card.

93276.name: Walter Payton Football
93276.description:
User Summary

In Walter Payton Football, you can choose from 28 teams, the view is overhead, the graphics are very basic, but you can select your play, and there are even some cutscenes.

93277.name: Arcade Smash Hits
93277.description:
Arcade Smash Hits was a game published by Sega and was released in the year 1992 for the Sega Master System. The game had a choice of 3 arcade games to play. They are Centipede, Breakout and Missile Command. These were 3 classic arcade games from previous consoles.

Source: Wikipedia, "Arcade Smash Hits", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

93278.name: Assault City
videogameversion: Europe Master System Control Pad edition
Europe Master System Light Gun edition
93278.description:
Assault City is a light gun, rail shooter released for Sega Master System in the year 1990. The player controls the role of Joe. He is the one of the last humans remaining that can overturn the robot regime. Nothing can stop him from destroying the control system which forces the robots to kill.

In the latter half of the 21st century, robots have been engaged in labor in dangerous places, housework, etc. Then suddenly, the control system used to function these robots plotted a revolt against the human race, and ordered every robot to annihilate all of the people. The robots robbed them of their weapons, and occupied various military bases and factories. The war robots that were manufactured there murdered men one after another, and the survivors organized a resistance and went into a full-scale offensive against the enemy's army.

Source: Wikipedia, "Assault City", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

93279.name: Tru$t
93279.description:
Tru$t, an exciting new board game for two to six players. Buy an entire island! Invest your way to billions! Gain controlling interest in your corporation! Force your partner to sell you out!

Tru$t is a game based on the ownership of corporations. There are 11 corporations in the game, each of which is made up of two to five divisions. A player may own part of all of a corporation. Ownership of all the divisions in a corporation is known as a "trust." In Tru$t, ownership of a corporation is shared when two or more players own division of the same corporation. The owners of such corporations are at the same time both partners and opponents.

Tru$t is played by moving your token around the board from island to island, buying and developing divisions of the corporations, collecting payments and dividends, and paying debts. The game ends when only one player remains who had ownership in any corporation.

93280.name: Small Arms
93280.description:
From the PDF
Small Arms is an expansion for the x6 game system dealing with modern portable firearms, including pistols, rifles and some machine guns. The core edition of x6 included a small selection of weapons that was mostly designed as an appetiser and may not suit the need for more variety and detail some gamers have. This expansion examines modern firearms in greater detail, offering more weapons, equipment and supplementary rules.

93281.name: x6 Revamp
93281.description:
RPG Website
This is an expanded version of the x6 character sheet, fitting more info in a single page.

93282.name: x6 NPC Character Sheet
93282.description:
RPG Website
This is a handy sheet containing stats of up to 4 NPCs in a single page.

93283.name: Wealth
93283.description:
From the PDF
Wealth is an expansion for the x6 game system dealing with what makes the world go round - money. It is best suited for modern settings, where money as a commodity is fluid and easily transferable, as opposed to past eras where assets were more tangible and had more or less fixed values. Wealth in a medieval game would probably take the form of gold, land or a combination of the two. In a modern setting wealth can be very variable, from hard cash and property to holding a stake in a booming corporation. This expansion attempts to deal with all those factors in abstract terms.

93284.name: Ghettopocalypse
93284.description:
From the RPG Website
This is a cyberpunk setting based on a modified version of x6.

93285.name: Party Gras
93285.description:
With a game name like Party Gras, you better believe the goal of this game is to collect more strings of beads than any other player.

At the start of the game, the players divide the beads evenly amongst themselves, then place the beads around their necks. Each player receives two challenges cards out of the 300 hundred in the game. Each challenge card features three challenges from the following categories:

• Mind Control – Get another player to do what's listed on the card, such as asking you to lower your voice.
• Caught in the Act – Spot someone doing the action listed on the card, such as text messaging.
• Talk It Out – Start a conversation and find someone who satisfies the condition listed, such as liking werewolves more than vampires.
• Fashion Police – Find someone who matches the description on the card, such as two players who have shirts of the same color.
• Go Crazy & Challenge – Do what the card tells you to do.

If you find someone who fits the challenge, then show that player the card and take 1-2 beads from that player, as noted on the card. Discard that card and take a new one. Anyone de-beaded due to a card can choose to discard one card in hand and draw a new one.

The player with the most beads once the preset time limit expires wins the game.

93286.name: Color War
93286.description:
Color War is a abstract game for two players. In each turn, a player use a card of his hand, move a pawn of his color, and take a new card from the common pool of cards. The game has only 8 cards, 2 in the hand of each player, and 4 in a common pool.
And that is all. The first player that match her pawns with the spaces of the same color, win. If nobody win in 10 turns, then each player score their pawns, depending of their final position.
A variant called "the isle" have a neutral pawn that the 2 players can move in the turn, using it to block the rival, bau in this case, this turno don´t move his pawn.

93287.description:
Trading card game for the Final Fantasy video game world.

Each player uses their own deck of 50 character cards. Players play character cards by using CP (crystal points).

There are three kinds of character cards:

Forward character card: attackers, blockers and characters with various abilities.
Backup character card: producing CP and/or with various abilities.
Summoned Creature card: one shot ability.




If the player discards a card, they produce 2 CP. If the player taps (dulls) his backup character card, he produces 1 CP.

On their turn, the current player can attack his opponent using his own forward character, and the opponent can block the attacker with their forward character. If the opponent does not block the attacker, one damage is dealt.

When you deal 7 damage to your opponent, you win the game.

Popular characters of various Final Fantasy video games appear in this game.
93287.name: Final Fantasy Trading Card Game

93288.name: Český film
93288.description:
In the game, see 1800 Czech film interesting questions about Czech cinema and 300 tasks for the party variant of the game. Questions are divided into six areas: film until 1989, after the 1989 film, filmmakers and actors, bedtime stories and fairy tales, movie lines and misc. The party game variant you perform, describe and draw characters from both films.
Answer correctly one question for every category and there is final question. If You answer this correctly You win.

93289.name: Česko Evropa
93289.description: Expansion to Česko (Czechia), questions and answers. Adds 1200 questions/answers to the original games about Europe.

93291.name: Żołnierze wyklęci
93291.description:
Self published 2 person card game, donated with the money from polish Ministry of Culture. On some cards there are inscriptions with educational or biographical informations. The game was sold in randomized starter packs with single cards avalaible for separate sell.

The game is set in historical setting. It tells a story of a dramatic 20 years struggle between anticommunist insurgents and communist government security forces "UB" in forests of central and eastern Poland between 1944-1963.

Players can play cards -fighters, equipment and areas from both sides of a conflict in corresponding zones. One player communist army fight with the others insurgents and vice versa. Combat is resolved via dices and strenght of a fighting pack.

93292.name: Bankshot Billiards 2
93292.description:
The pool (pocket billiards) simulator offers nine different game modes including nine-ball, eight-ball, Euro eight-ball (blackball), cutthroat, 14.1 continuous (straight pool), three-ball, trick shots, "Time Trial" (speed pool), and golf. It offers a wide range of graphic customization including table style, felt color, wood grain, ball set, and cue stick.

Source: Wikipedia, "Bankshot Billiards 2", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

93293.name: GraalOnline Era
93293.description:
Fight using assault rifles, shotguns, and more! This 2D adventure pits you against the ruthless gangs that run the streets of Graal. Few can survive the challenge: are you up to it?

Recommended for everyone who likes GraalOnline Classic, shooting games or online games in general.

Source: The Developer Website.

93294.name: Axel & Pixel
93294.description:
The game is a traditional point-and-click adventure, where the player has to logically come up with answers and solutions to riddles and problems that are encountered during the course of the game. As a way of making Axel & Pixel unique from other point-and-click adventures, the cursor is made up of a group of glittering lights, which change colour slightly if the player lands the cursor on a point of interest. The Xbox controller also vibrates in this occurrence to make it obvious to the player. Aside from the traditional point-and-click mechanics, the game also features three different platform mini-games - 'Hot Air Loons', 'Four Wheel Dives' and 'Sailing Through', respectively. The game also makes use of quick time events in a few of the chapters as ways of helping Axel scale walls or avoiding dangerous obstacles. The game is divided into four sections - in the form of the four calendar seasons - which are unlocked through natural progression of the story. Each of the mini-games featured are used once in story mode as ways of pursuing Evil Rat through the dream world, from the last chapter of the current calendar season into the beginning of the next one. Unlike most point-and-click adventures, Axel & Pixel contains no dialogue option between characters, in an attempt to keep the gameplay focused more on solving the puzzles instead of interactions. Axel, however, will speak gibberish to Pixel and to himself occasionally.

Source: Wikipedia, "Axel & Pixel", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

93297.name: DOGFIGHT!
93297.description:
User Summary

In DOGFIGHT! you control a fighter plane engaged in a dogfight. You must direct your fighter into a position, ensuring that it can fire upon the enemies, but so that it will not be fired upon in the same time. You will use your finger to drag across the screen, creating the flight path your plane will travel along.

93298.name: Cats, Inc.
93298.description:
There are three cats. And there are sausages. The cats want sausages. But the cats aren't smart enough to get to sausages on their own, and only you can help them!

In this physics-based puzzle game your goal is to get the cats over to the next levels, collecting sausages, and overcoming obstacles. Each of three cats has special abilities, and you will need to figure out which one's should be used.

30 levels with increasing difficulty will keep you and your children entertained for hours!

Source: The Developer Website.

93299.name: Doodle Toss
93299.description:
Remember all those times you wanted to hit your teacher with a paper airplane but just couldn’t? Doodle Toss allows you to live out your childhood fantasy. Strategically launch planes to beat the wind and strike the annoying teacher at his desk. Watch him go red, tear out his hair and squeak complaints. This game offers a bundle of laughs to sharp shooters.

Source: The Developer Website.

93300.name: Die Welt des Schwarzen Auges
93300.description:
User summary

Die Welt des Schwarzen Auges is a boxed set that broadly describes the world of Aventurien.

The box contains:


Die Welt des Schwarzen Auges - 120 pages - history and regions of Aventurien
Enzyklopedaedia Aventurica - 136 pages - Essays on various topics like laws, games, armies, etc.
Geographical poster map
Political poster map
"Hand-drawn" poster map showing Aventurien and other continents
Errata sheet

93301.name: aYa-Manku
93301.description:
You play as a chief fruit collector of Manku-un. Your missions:
- Master 18 fruit mines with over 75 challenging areas
- 6 unlockable collectors
- Over 50 achievements and online leaderboards
- Player vs. Player Challenges

Source: The Developer Website.

93302.name: Catapult Madness
93302.description:
User Summary

In this game, you live in a castle that's currently under siege by trolls and orcs. You must use the castles only catapult to throw a citizen to the neighbouring castle, in order to for their aid. As the game rogresses, you will gain money to buy upgrades such as beans, magic spells, a hangglider and others.

93303.name: Wind über Weiden
93303.description:
User summary

Wind über Weiden is a solitaire adventure for Das Schwarze Auge, suitable for a knight character of levels 1 to 3.

The adventure as all about upholding knightly values. The character is a young knight who sets out to participate in a turney in Trallop. Challenges await him on the journey and at his destination.

93304.name: Compendium Salamandris
93304.description:
User summary

The Compendium Salamandris is a magic sourcebook for Das Schwarze Auge. It mostly consists of FAQ sections for various topics interspersed with short essays

It essays cover:

The Dream World
The alchemist as a new character class
Alchemical recipes
Spellbooks and magical theories
Artifact creation
Golems
Magic law and magic guilds

93305.name: Cablink
93305.description:
User Summary

Cablink is a puzzle game, in which you must connect a power source with the other power sources, by turning different wires to link them all up.

The game featurs a wide range of different puzzles and game modes, and even includes the option to share your favourite puzzles with others by using each puzzle's unique "Puzzle Code".

93306.name: Edition Troll: Welt der Spiele Sammelband
93306.description:
User summary

The Edition Troll - Welt der Spiele Sammelband is a compilation of three randomized generic fantasy adventures that have been glued together in a single cover.

The adventures are randomly selected from the following items, which have also been available separately:

Elfenbanner
Sternenhöh
Ruinen des Schreckens
Merlins Lieder
Gralfsee
Zeit des Nebels
Geister der Vergangenheit
Im Auftrag des Königs
Beowulfs Saga
Zauberspiegel - Im Banne Zaccatas
Tod einer Priesterin




This was an attempt to make some money of excess stock. The adventures that were glued together included the cardstock covers, which makes browsing difficult and tends to break the binding.

The page count depends on the adventures that were included.

93307.name: Signs & Portents (Issue 88 - Jan 2011)
rpgissuearticle: A Call to Arms: Noble Armada
Destiny: Within the Two Thousand Worlds
rpg: Judge Dredd the Roleplaying Game (MGP Traveller)
93307.description:
In this month's issue;

A Call to Arms: Noble Armada
The final preview before release next month, taking a look at the various weaponry available in the game.

Deus Vult
A complete scenario for Deus Vult, which sees the players searching for a knight bearing a holy relic.

Traveller
A look at parallel dimensions in campaigns.

Clockwork & Chivalry
A variety of new weapons and other martial tools with which to tease opponents.

Lone Wolf
A complete scenario, which will pit the players against a newly emerged Cener Druid with diabolical plans for the area.

A Call to Arms: Noble Armada
The first battle report for the new space fleet combat game!

Age of Treason
A new setting for RuneQuest is unveiled...

Paranoia
Completing the hatrick of adventures in this issue, a mission for Troubleshooters that will see them testing security systems in Alpha Complex. Nothing could go wrong there, then...

Traveller
The space bazaar looks at a variety of weird and wonderful alien artefacts.

Judge Dredd
Going into the Cursed Earth? Look out for these beasties...

Earthdawn
An excerpt from the forthcoming Cathay books, featuring the Daughters of Heaven.

Traveller
A classic Traveller article returns, looking at the Two Thousand Worlds.

93308.name: Grim Joggers
93308.description:
In Grim Joggers the player leads a group of 15 joggers as far as possible before all of them face a gruesome end. It's an arcade-style survival game with online leaderboards and achievements. It's jogging become bloodsport!


Four unique worlds
Several ways to die
Extreme playability
Universal App
Over two dozen Game Center achievements
Game Center leaderboards
Probably the most brutal jogging game out there
Easy to learn controls
Fun for those who love jogging or hate jogging


Source: The Game Website.

93309.name: Signs & Portents (Issue 89 - Feb 2011)
rpgissuearticle: New Ships for the US Navy
rpg: Judge Dredd the Roleplaying Game (MGP Traveller)
93309.description:
Publisher blurb (from website):

Weighing in at 92 pages of free gaming goodness, the latest issue of Signs & Portents is ready for download! You can grab it now from the link below.

In this month's issue;

RuneQuest II
A complete supplement, featuring shamans and spirits in an all new magic system.

Judge Dredd
The clock is ticking in a short investigation for a patrol of judges.

Traveller
A new patron for Travellers, that ties into the soon-to-be released Animal Encounters.

Victory at Sea
New ships for the US Navy by David Manley.

Traveller
Inspired by the creepiest of sci-fi, the Travellers will confront the Thing in the Pit in this new scenario.

Paranoia
A look at the finer instruments available for clones in the R&D department.

Clockwork & Chivalry
Continuing the look at weapons and armour in this ECW setting.

Corporation
A look at an attempt to make a new and better breed of human.

Elric of Melnibone
A chance to visit the barbaric half-men of Alofia.

Lone Wolf
Discover the city of Lof in the Kingdom of Durenor.

Wraith Recon
A look at the petty lords and bandit kings who rule the darker areas of Lorn and Dardarrick, and why they draw the attention of the Wraiths.

Traveller
Two classic creatures, revitalised and brought back for the current edition.

RuneQuest II
An introductory scenario that will see players start off as young members of an Orlanthi tribe.

A Call to Arms: Noble Armada
A look at the very latest ships to emerge from the Noble Houses.

93310.name: Heroes of Kalevala
93310.description:
Choose your favorite hero and lead your tribe towards a bright new future in the lands of Kalevala.

Exciting new match-3 mechanics, powerful hero powerups, and an extensive village building game provide hours of exciting new entertainment. Experience over 140 hand made levels featuring never before seen match-3 game play like lock bomb combos and tar fights. Build your own village from scratch and see how it starts to thrive and produce wealth. Can your tribe acquire the fabled Sampo?


Match and build your very own custom village
Over 140 unique hand made levels
Eight powerful heroes with distinct abilities
Story with english language voice overs
Play as long as you like after completing the story
Unique match-3 mechanics like tar fight and lock bombs


Source: The Developer Website.

93311.name: Sparkle
93311.description:
No one travels without worries in Crowberry Woods anymore!

Vast blackness has blanketed the once beautiful forest. Only small sparkles of light trickle through the all consuming darkness.

Use your orb slinger to shatter the orbs of darkness before they release their destructive powers. Can you bring the light back, from a sparkle to full bloom? Explore three different game modes, multitude of greater magical amulets and powerups, and uncover the deepest secrets. Don't leave the fair trees of Crowberry Woods unsparkled!

Source: The Publisher Website.

93312.name: Dragon (Hungarian Issue 8 - May 1999)
93312.description:
User summary

Main features of this issue:


Dragonlance fiction
Greyhawk: The Orbs of Dragonkind
Dark Sun: Elemental Summoning Gone Wild

93313.description:
Fantasy Flight Games is pleased to announce the upcoming release of Signs in the Stars, the fourth Battle Pack in The Morrslieb Cycle for Warhammer: Invasion The Card Game! When the foul taint of Chaos disrupts the tranquility of Athel Loren, a lone Waywatcher may be the Wood Elves’ last hope of defending their homeland against total destruction.

Signs in the Stars adds a host of new deck-building options to your Warhammer: Invasion experience. This 60 card pack contains 20 different never-before-seen cards designed to augment existing decks and add variety to the Warhammer: Invasion metagame.

The High Elves’ Bladelord dominates the battlefield with his mastery of the Path of the Autumn Wind, while the Dark Elves’ Enraged Manticore lays waste to everything it sees. Meanwhile, the Empire hero Luthor Huss charges into battle, and the Dwarfs observe the battle from the safety of their Gyrocopter!
93313.name: Warhammer: Invasion – Signs in the Stars

93314.name: Schwingen aus Schnee
93314.description:
User summary

Schwingen aus Schnee (Wings of Snow) is an adventure for Das Schwarze Auge, suitable for 3-5 player characters of levels 10 to 13.

During the battle on the Vallusanian Fields, the Swan Wings - one of three pairs of Wings of the Winged Riders - has been destroyed by demonic force, rendering the other two pairs useless.

The characters are tasked with following the ancient myths that surround the wings to find a way how to recreate them. They have to enter the ice fields of the high north and brave the dangers that await them there.

93315.name: Mind's Eye Theatre Journal #7
rpgissuearticle: Gehenna Wears a Purple Dress Tonight
Wraith Merits and Flaws for Oblivion
rpg: Laws of the Wild (1st and 2nd Editions)
93315.description:
From Back Cover:

This issue presents:

A guide to acting in live-action play
Dharmas heretical to all self-respecting Kuei-jin
A look at the hideous fomori
Motivation to torch my effigy
Topical issues on live-action roleplaying and more




The Journal provides everything you need to make your Mind's Eye Theatre chronicles more diverse, complex and complete!

What do you want to see?

93316.name: Mind's Eye Theatre Journal #8
rpg: Laws of the Wild (1st and 2nd Editions)
93316.description:
From Back Cover:

Welcome to the Mind's Eye Theatre Journal, the magazine that picks up where other Mind's Eye publications leave off.

This issue presents:

Tips on creating memorable antagonists
Advice on managing large or long-running LARP chronicles
A look back and a look ahead
World of Darkness fiction
Topical issues on live-action roleplaying and more




The Journal provides everything you need to make your Mind's Eye Theatre chronicles more diverse, complex and complete!

What do you want to see?

93317.name: Ränkespieler & Rivalen
93317.description:
User summary

Ränkespieler & Rivalen (Schemers & Rivals) is an adventure collection for Das Schwarze Auge, suitable for 3-5 unexperienced player characters. All adventures are winning entries of the Hannover Spielt! convention of 2003.

The book contains three adventures:

In Ein Hauch von Schmerz (A Touch of Pain) the characters are hired to challenge the examinees of the Combat Seminary of Andergast. What sounds like an easy job drops the characters into a cesspool of intrigue.

Artistenschuh und Rote Bälle (Acrobat's Shoe and Red Balls) provides more intrigue, this time in the city of Methumis. The characters have the chance to thwart some plots of evil nobles.

Nach Rastullahs Willen (At Rastullah's Will) leads the characters into the Khôm desert where they attend a bridal combat of the Beni Khivad tribe.

93318.name: Mind's Eye Theatre: Laws of Ascension Companion
93318.description:
From publisher blurb:

Traditions and Technocrats
How does the Technocratic Union function? What special talents and procedures do its operatives study? Who are the Disparates? Why is their magic apart from the Tradition Council? Marauders and Nephandi, Technocrats and Traditionalists, Disparate mages and the magical beings they encounter the magical world'smore than just the sum of the Council of Nine.

Madmen and Malfeasance
Here you'll find supplemental material for Mind's Eye Theatre's Laws of Ascension, covering such topics as creating Technocracy characters and chronicles, traveling the Umbral byways, fighting the wiles of mythic creatures and dealing with the lost Disparate magical orders. Plus, a ton of new rotes and some additional rule options to expand the potential of live-action Mage ® games.

93319.name: Miriel's Enchanted Mystery
93319.description:
Miriel returns in an exciting sequel. Find out what's the story behind the mysterious egg artifact and journey through four unique locations.

Create bread, potions, cakes, colored cloth, and a lot of other of exciting products. Use powerful spells to aid your tasks and buy more products and skills from the shop. Miriel's Enchanted Mystery is ripe with entertaining choices.

Source: The Publisher Website.

93320.name: Fremde Gefährten
93320.description:
User summary

Fremde Gefährten (Strange Fellows) is an adventure collection for Das Schwarze Auge, suitable for 3-5 unexperienced player characters. All adventures are winning entries of the Hannover Spielt! convention of 2004.

The book contains three adventures:

Echsenbrut (Lizard Spawn) is an adventure set in the Lizard Swamps. The characters will get the opportunity to explore some parts of the swamp areas, meet the strange lizardmen, and become involuntary stepparents of a scaly foundling.

Schrecken im Eis (Terror in the Ice) leads the characters into the northern regions of Aventurien. Yetis have kidnapped some people and the characters have to get them back.

The characters save a goblin from drowning and receive a quest that lets them live Unter Goblins (Among Goblins).

93321.name: Miriel the Magical Merchant
93321.description:
Meet Miriel - a shy but hardworking and earnest young woman who has the gift of magic. The ordinary life of this extraordinary girl is about to suddenly change as she gets the message she has been waiting for months.

Enter the magical world of Miriel and help her to fulfill her dreams. Prepare delicious bread, cakes, and more to keep eager customers satisfied while building a general store empire through the magical Kingdom. Miriel needs your help!

Source: The Publisher Website.

93322.name: Dragon Portals
93322.description:
The friendly dragons have been bound to earth with dark magic! You have the chance to save the dragons with our radiant heroine Mila. Throughout more than 70 levels you'll experience four fantastic environments and more than a dozen amazing powerups. Dragon Portals features truly innovative game mechanics, three different game modes, beautiful worlds, alluring musical soundscapes, and a radiant atmosphere. These qualities make this superb puzzle game a must have for everyone who likes their games fresh, fun, and beautiful.

Source: The Publisher Website.

93323.name: Das Vermächtnis der Völker
93323.description:
User summary

Das Vermächtnis der Völker (Legacy of the Peoples) is an adventure for Das Schwarze Auge, suitable for 3-6 experienced player characters.

The adventure is designed to let the players explore elven culture. The plot revolves around a conflict between a group of elves that want further the cooperation between humans, and the elves that oppose this development.

93324.name: Crimsonland
93324.description:
Crimsonland is an action packed PC game developed by the Finnish company 10tons Entertainment. This top-down shooter has all the characteristics of classic shooter games with the hardware-accelerated graphics of today.

Crimsonland features three different Game Play Modes as well as a secret mode that can be unlocked when the Quest Game Mode is completed. In Quest Mode, players can level up by eliminating a set number of monsters, with each new level introducing new weapons, perks, and powerups. Players will need to keep on their toes, as each new level will spawn more challenging, and an increasing number of enemies. Rush Mode is a fairly simple concept, fend off the hordes of monsters and survive as long as you possibly can.
