Survival mode is a mixture of both the Quest and Rush Modes, as you kill monsters you gain experience points that will allow you to obtain perks which help you stay alive and get as much experience as you can.

Source: The Developer Website.

93325.name: iDracula - Undead Awakening
93325.description:
You are the hunter. Vampire hunter. Well, not quite. In fact, you are being hunted. Or you're just trying to survive a little more against the horde of Vampires, Werewolves, Witches and Dracula himself.

Can you survive the night? iDracula is an intense survival shooter - the most intense game in the App Store. You begin with a simple gun and slow monsters, but as the time passes, they grow stronger and faster, dropping better weapons. You will also be able to gain "perks", as you earn enough experience!

Source: The Publisher Website.

93326.name: Talent Dare: Music
93326.description:
Do you have a hidden musical talent? Discover your talent with Talent Dare: Music! See who's the musical genius of the posse.

Source: The Developer Website.

93327.name: Boom Brigade
93327.description:
For fans of tower defense, line drawing or top down shooters 10tons presents Boom Brigade. Unique mix of three genres resulting in an enjoyable and amazingly playable experience. Control up to three troopers and show the alien scum who's the boss! Choose your weapons, command your troops and survive as long as possible.

Source: The Developer Website.

93328.description:
Let's Grow The Life Cycles Game encourages deeper understanding of life cycles.
- Reinforces understanding of developmental stages of a chicken, frog, butterfly and plant
- Engages children as they race to complete a life-cycle puzzle using memory match strategies.

Players select a life-cycle game card: chicken, frog, butterfly or plant. Spin to move around the board, uncovering puzzle pieces to fill in his/her life cycle. First one to complete a life-cycle card wins!

Components:

game board
4 life-cycle game cards,
16 puzzle pieces,
4 pawns,
spinner
93328.name: Let's Grow

93329.name: Xenotracker
93329.description:
Your fate has already been sealed. Now it's just a question of time. They have picked up your human scent and you can already hear them. It's time to make the last stand and take some of them with you. Armed with your standard issue motion tracker and your trustworthy assault rifle you will have to fight them as long as you can. They are coming from all directions and there is only one of you. You will eventually run out of life, but luckily you have lots of bullets to spare before that. How long can you survive?

Source: The Developer Website.

93330.name: Rope Raider
93330.description:
Choose one of the three different game modes and plunge down from your trusty old hot air balloon. Use your grappling hook with accuracy and time your swings right to gain speed and reach new heights. Immersive city filled with atmosphere amplifies the entertaining experience. Customize your gaming experience with three different game modes and three different difficulty levels. Rope Raider will get you swinging in no time!

Source: The Developer Website.

93331.name: Bienenschwarm & Diskusflug
93331.description:
User summary

Bienenschwarm & Diskusflug (Bee Swarm & Discus Flight) is an adventure collection for Das Schwarze Auge, suitable for 3-5 experienced player characters. It contains the three winning entries from the adventure writing contest of the Hannover Spielt! convention of 2005.

In Die Überlegenen (The Outstanding), the player characters rescue a priest from an ambush and try to retrieve a magical spear for him. During their quest, they will have the chance to gain insight into the Rur and Gror religion of Maraskan.

Tränenharz (Tear Resin) draws the characters into a conflict between Praios followers and Norbards while escorting an amber caravan.

Preiset die Schönheit! (Beauty Be Praised!) is a murder mystery set in the sub-culture of exiled Maraskans in the city of Festum.

93332.name: Belowscape
93332.description:
Try Belowscape. It's awesome! Fast paced action game for iPhone and iPod Touch inspired by Robotron, Smash TV, Crimsonland, and Geometry Wars. Tilt the device to move. Lay it flat to not move. Touch the screen to change the firing direction.

Source: The Developer Website.

93334.name: Die Gesichtslose und andere Abenteuer
93334.description:
User summary

Die Gesichtslose und andere Abenteuer (The Faceless and other adventures) is a collection of four adventures for Das Schwarze Auge, suitable for 3-5 inexperienced player characters.

Die Gesichtslose (The Faceless) begins with the characters saving a daughter of an important member of the Beni Szelemjati tribe from mutated lizardmen. They are sent after the lizardmen leader that is said to be behind the attack, but things are not as they seem.

In Funkenflug (Flying Sparks), a wounded baron asks the players to rescue an elven princess from a fortress of the Bannstrahler Order.

Die Kanope der Yilbakis (The Canopic Jar of the Yilbakis) falls into the hands of the player characters as they stumble upon a mortally wounded Novadi warrior during a festival in Temphis. But the jar is robbed and the characters take up the chase.

Nächtlicher Schrecken (Nightly Terror) is a story of demonic possession.

93335.name: Contagion Infected Zombie Humans
93335.description:
Publisher Blurb:
This new supplement contains everything you will need to insert Contagion Infected Human Zombies into any Pathfinder campaign. Whether you’re basing your campaign in the world of Aruneus or simply want to include a zombie outbreak in an existing or new campaign world, this supplement is for you.

Aruneus is a source book for the Pathfinder Role Playing Game detailing the world, politics and life of those living in a high fantasy world one hundred years after a cataclysmic zombie apocalypse.

This publication conatains:

A brief history of Aruneus

Stat blocks and Special Attributes for three types of Contagion Infected Human Zombies:

Decrepit
Old
Standard

A new rule: Head Shot

Four new feats

Demographics for the world of Aruneus before and after the zombie apocalypse.

Encounter Charts

New Magic Item: The Vial of Life

Newly revised with all errata to date added in, a brand new layout and new art!

93336.name: Im Schatten Simyalas
93336.description:
User summary

Im Schatten Simyalas (In the Shadow of Simyala) is a compilation of three Das Schwarze Auge adventures that form the campaign of the same name. It is suitable for 3-6 inexperienced player characters.

It contains updated versions of

A098: Namenlose Dämmerung
A107: Stein der Mada
A108: Der Basiliskenkönig




The elven city Simyala has been destroyed by the Basilisk King a long time ago. It's location has been lost in time. Now dark powers try to find it. The heroes are on a divine quest to find Simyala before them.

93337.name: Orcs
93337.description:
Publisher Blurb:
This supplement contains everything you will need to insert the Aruneus Orc Player Character into any Pathfinder campaign. Whether you're basing your campaign on the world of Aruneus or simply want to include Orcs in your campaign world, this supplement is for you.

It contains:


A History of the Orcs
Descriptions of Orcs and their society in the world of Aruneus
Orc Racial Traits
Two new Creatures: the Hram and the Penumbral Atavus
Prestige Class: The War Leader
Three Orc NPCs: The Herd Rider, the Bardic Herald and the Clan War Leader
Two Magical Items: The Bridle of Control and the Scimitar of Command

93338.name: Zombie Cards
93338.description:
Publisher Blurb:
The problem with a zombie apocalypse is that there are so many darned zombies. It can become hard for you, the GM to keep track of them all. Enter the Contagion Infected Zombie Cards. Not to worry, it's the zombies that are infected, not the cards.

On each these cards you'll find all of the important stats for each of the three types of zombies, plus an easy way of keeping track of their hit points (starting and current) whether or not they have additional armor and a helm (meaning a Head Shot isn't possible), current AC and whether or not they've moved or not.

Just check off the number of each type of zombie you want and off you go! How many zombies make a party? Use the Encounter Chart to determine the exact number of deadly, infected and hungry undead come shambling towards your party.

Track up to 15 of each type of Contagion Infected Zombie. Or just grab a bunch of cards and make your party very, very nervous.

Print this out double sided to save paper and to get yourself some double sided zombie cards.

93339.name: Orkengold
93339.description:
User summary

Orkengold (Orcish Gold) is an adventure campaign for Das Schwarze Auge. It is suitable for 3-6 experienced player characters.

The characters are sent to retrieve a meteor from the orcish lands They have strong competition and will find many opportunities for exploration, combat and negotiations. The adventure is designed to reveal more details about orcish history and culture.

93340.name: Masks of Magic and More
rpgseries: Troll in the Corner's Magical Emporium
93340.description:
From the book:
We have for you today a selection of magical masks utilized in esoteric rituals by the most barbaric of peoples! And we mean that in no sense to portray barbarians as anything other than the fine, upstanding and occasionally psychotic individuals who are always welcome to spend their hard earned coins at our Emporium!

In addition to our selection of magical masks, we've unearthed the rarest of intellectual weapons! Strange shamanic talismans guaranteed to bring luck and vision! A cursed item that is so vile we can only sell it to licensed collectors! Licenses are available via our scribe for 10 GP per person.

Inside you will find:

The Mask of the Hunter (Wondrous Item)

The Mask of the Prey (Wondrous Item)

The Powder Mask (Wondrous Item)

Quietus Mask (Wondrous Item)

Bag O Bones (Magical Item)

Sword of Minkin'Mar (Intelligent Magical Weapon)

The Ethereal Hook (Magical Item)

The Heart Plug (cursed item)

The Button of Charming (Magical Item)

And a bonus item: The Orcish Mask of Atavus (Wondrous Item) to go along with our soon to be released The World of Aruneus - The Orcs!

93341.name: Ubik
93341.description:
In 1998, Cryo Interactive Entertainment released Philip K. Dick’s Ubik, a tactical action/strategy videogame very loosely based on the book. The game allowed players to act as Joe Chip and train combat squads into missions against the Hollis Corporation. The game was available for PlayStation and for Microsoft Windows and was not a significant commercial success.

Source: Wikipedia, "Ubik", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

93342.name: Mirkmoot's Magical Accouterments for Creatures Small and Great
rpgseries: Troll in the Corner's Magical Emporium
93342.description:
From the book:
We here at Troll in the Corner's Magical Emporium were recently approached by our Goblin counterpart, Mirkmoot, with a cross promotional offer we found ourselves unable to refuse. Magical items for small beings such as Gnomes, Halflings, Goblins and many others!

Initially skeptical about this cross promotion, we decided to move forward with it because the items are uniquely designed for players of smaller stature and we owe Mirkmoot a good deal of money.

Mirkmoot is the Goblin people's premier Wizard extraordinaire! He is quite possibly the only Goblin in living memory to attain the rank of Wizard, 3rd class or master the art of multiplication.

He brought us a whole wheelbarrow full of items and we've had to use every available wizard to work out exactly what they are and how they work. And why some of them are pink. His grasp of the common language can be a bit wanting and he insisted on naming his items himself, hence the unorthodox, wonderfully quaint naming scheme. It's ah, enbeautiful!

These items, they are certainly . . . unique! Never before have we come across a group of magical items so striking. Mirkmoot's sense of style and his near mastering of the art of creating magical items is unmatched by anyone we've ever met before. He has a certain ability to bring out qualities in magical items that are both unexpected and unique!

This expansion contains the following Items for use with creatures of Small size:

Mirkmoot's Belt of Enbiginating (Magical Item)
Mirkmoot's Helm of Engoblinating (Magical Armor)
Mirkmoot's Helm of Unenngoblinating (Magical Armor)
Mirkmoot's Dagger of Enstabbing (Magical Weapon)
Mirkmoot's Fob of Unenincarcerating (Magical Item)
Mirkmoot's Glorious Helm of Engloryating (Magical Armor)
Mirkmoot's Short Bow of Redeadifying (Magical Weapon)
Mirkmoot's Bardy Lute of Unbardsuckifying (Magical...er... Instrument?)
Mirkmoot's Tube of Fabulous Enseeing (Wondrous Item)
Mirkmoot's Ring of Encursing (Magical Ring)
Mirkmoot's Helm of Enseeing Really Far (Wondrous Armor)
Mirkmoot's Tablet of Easy Writingness (Wondrous Item)

93343.name: Die Verdammten des Südmeers
93343.description:
User summary

Die Verdammten des Südmeers (The Damned of the South Sea) is an adventure campaign for Das Schwarze Auge. It is suitable for 3-5 player characters of medium experience.

A treasure map brings the characters on the track of a pirate and his legendary loot. On their way, they unveil a quite different story of an Efferd priest and his fight against an arch demon.

user note about the misprint version

The first printing had a misprint, where the title on the front cover wrongly read "Die Verdammtem des Südmeers" instead of the correct "Die Verdammten des Südmeers". Most of the flawed print run was destroyed and a correct version was printed. But one case of the books was held back by the publisher, who gave some of them to his employees as a souvenir. Later at least ten of the misprints got into public hands, when they were given away by the publisher to fans as prize for a competition.

93344.name: Mirkmoot's More Magical Mayhem for Creatures Small and Great
rpgseries: Troll in the Corner's Magical Emporium
93344.description:
From the book:
We here at Troll in the Corner's Magical Emporium are constantly searching the known and unknown worlds to bring you, our wealthy and overly encumbered adventurers, the finest magical items. We've journeyed the planes, trawled lakes of fire, flitted through realms composed of clouds and consorted with demon princes and godlings.

We're not quite sure why it is then, that we continue to be fascinated with the objects created by one forlorn and grumpy goblin, but fascinate us the creations of Mirkmoot certainly do!

We're ecstatic to announce then that Mirkmoot has returned! Actually, he hasn't so much returned as never left, really. We've tried asking him to leave but every time we get as far as "We'd like to have our bathroom back and. . . " he vanishes in a cloud of toilet paper and eventually turns up mumbling to himself hours or days later.

93345.name: Volfied
93345.description:
Volfied (ヴォルフィード Vorufīdo?) (also known as Ultimate Qix on the Sega Mega Drive/Genesis or Qix Neo on PlayStation) is an arcade game released by Taito in 1989. A port for MS-DOS has been developed by Empire Interactive and published by Taito in 1991.

The game is an updated version of Qix, with extra features and a futuristic science fiction aesthetic, rather than Qix's abstract geometry style. The player pilots a small spaceship instead of a simple dot and the enemies come in the form of various aliens.

The overall gameplay is identical to that of Qix. However, the main enemy is no longer a collection of lines - instead it varies between levels, and is always accompanied by smaller enemies. When the player's spaceship succeeds in claiming a section of the level, the side where the main enemy is taken as "the outside". Any smaller enemies ending up on "the inside" are killed, resulting in point bonuses. In order to complete a level, the player must claim at least 80% of a level's area. Previously, the limits were 75% in Qix and 70% in Super Qix. Each level in Volfied has a unique background and enemies. As the player claims areas of the level the cleared area graphic is replaced with the graphic of the next level. Grey boxes also appear on the field - these give the player a random power-up when collected. Power ups can grant the player speed or even weapons. There is a special completion bonus on certain levels, often attained by shooting the main enemy.

Source: Wikipedia, "Volfied", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

93346.name: Spring Cleaning Sale
rpgseries: Troll in the Corner's Magical Emporium
93346.description:
From the book:
Hello folks, it's that time again! Here at Troll in the Corner's Magical Emporium, where we have the finest magical accoutrements this side of...of...of a place that has not so fabulous stuff.

Spring is a special time for us. The boss makes us root through the cellars looking for anything even vaguely magical and then we get to practically give it away to you, the discerning adventurer.

This year our theme is Party at the Inn! All of these items are guaranteed to spice up your next party and make your soiree the to-go-to event of the year! Caution: Some items may cause permanent, irreversible damage to the wielder, creatures in the immediate vicinity and possibly minor deities.

93347.name: Clerics & Wizards
93347.description:
From the book:
Aruneus is a new world for use with the Pathfinder Role Playing Game. 100 years past, Aruneus experienced an apocalyptic event. Starting in a small village, a family infected by a strange sickness died, only to rise again several days later. Within weeks hordes of undead were roaming the Human empires, ravaging any warm blooded creature that fell in to their grasp. Aruneus was devastated - losing in a few years over 10 million sentient beings.

After 100 years of fending off a complete collapse, the sentient races are rebuilding their societies and for the first time there is hope that the undead menace can be destroyed and life given a chance to flourish again.

This supplement contains details on the Order of the White Cloth and magic users in the world of Aruneus, including the rise to power of the Order of the White Cloth and the fall of the Wizards under the Order’s rule.

93348.name: The Dwarven Empire
93348.description:
User Summary: Free pdf product describing the Dwarves in the World of Aruneus setting.

From the book:
Unwilling or unable to deal with urgent requests from their Human allies, the majority of the Dwarves (those not concerned with outside trade) were taken completely by surprise when wave after wave of undead humans found their way into Dwarven territories. The King, who at the age of 170 was growing feeble, had taken to living well away from the mountains and leaving most administrative tasks to his son and heir, Prince Terriace Camere. Prince Camere was living in the night-blessed palatial residences at the time of the undead outbreak and failed to adequately prepare the underground city to repulse the zombie hordes. According to second hand reports compiled some years later, Ashcamere held out in one form or another for almost a full year after the initial wave of zombies overran the sun-sighted city.

93349.name: The World of Aruneus: A Brief History
93349.description:
From the book:
Aruneus is a new world for use with the Pathfinder Role Playing Game system. 100 years past, Aruneus experienced an apocalyptic event. Starting in a small village, a family infected by a strange sickness died, only to rise again several days later. Within weeks hordes of undead were roaming the Human empires, ravaging any warm blooded creature that fell in to their grasp. Aruneus was devastated - losing in a few years over 10 million sentient beings.

After 100 years of fending off a complete collapse, the sentient races are rebuilding their societies and for the first time there is hope that the undead menace can be destroyed and life given a chance to flourish again.

Presented here is a brief historical timeline of Aruneus from the arrival of the four races to the present day. This overview is to give game masters and players a historical perspective on the world of Aruneus.

93350.name: Stadtstreicher
93350.description:
User summary

Stadtstreicher (Tramp) contains four urban adventures for Das Schwarze Auge. It is suitable for 3-5 player characters of various experience levels. This book is designed to be used with the Patrizier und Diebesbanden supplement.

In Drachentöter (Dragonslayer) the characters help a couple of tavern owners with their newly established pub against competition, bagmen, spooks and burglars.

Verscherzt (Spoiled Chances) is a criminal mystery set during the carnival in Angbar.

The players are the target of a ruling villain in Mengbilla in Mummenschanz und Maskenspiel (Mummery and Masquerade). While hunting him, they stumble over unpleasant surprises.

The Beifang (Bycatch) of a whaler that seeks refuge in the port of Riva divides the citizens and threatens to break the peace with the Thorwalians.

93351.name: Knowledge Illuminates
93351.description:
From the book:

Knowledge Illuminates uses the Swords & Wizardry rule set and is the first in the One-Shot Adventure Series. These adventures are designed to be completed in a single session.

This adventure will be challenging for first and second level characters. Total levels of the party should not exceed eight.

I originally wrote this as an introduction adventure to provide my players with a starting point for the campaign. I wanted a short adventure that allowed players to test their characters and flex their dungeon delving skills. It had been a long time since we’d gone through an old fashion dungeon crawl. Another purpose of this adventure was to provide the players with a few more coins to upgrade their equipment, but much of the treasure, as the GM will discover, is not the loose coins the players will find. Lastly, the players could chose to clear out and repair the workshop to use as a base of operations. We know how players like to have their own clubhouse.

There are skill challenges included. If you are a GM who loathes skill checks, ignore them. Black them out if they offend. The skill rolls are denoted by difficulty level (DL) with a target number.

Lastly, the obligatory statement, the GM should alter any part of the adventure to suit his needs. Enjoy

93352.description:
The German strategic offensive named Operation Typhoon was planned to conduct two pincer offensives, one to the north of Moscow against the Kalinin Front by the 3rd and 4th Panzer Groups, simultaneously severing the Moscow - Leningrad railway, and another to the south of Moscow Oblast against the Western Front, south of Tula by the 2nd Panzer Army, while the 4th Army advanced directly towards Moscow from the west. A separate operational German plan, codenamed Operation Wotan, was included in the final phase of the German offensive.

This game allows to play the German assault and Soviet counter offensive that started on December 5th and was turning point for WWII.
93352.name: Moscow 1941

93353.description:
The Battle of Borodino, fought on September 7, 1812, was the largest and bloodiest single-day action of the French invasion of Russia, involving more than 250,000 troops and resulting in at least 70,000 casualties. The French Grande Armée under Emperor Napoleon I attacked the Imperial Russian Army of General Mikhail Kutuzov near the village of Borodino, west of the town of Mozhaysk, and eventually captured the main positions on the battlefield, but failed to destroy the Russian army. About a third of Napoleon's soldiers were killed or wounded; Russian losses, while heavier, could be replaced due to Russia's large population.

The battle at Borodino was a pivotal point in the campaign, as it was the last offensive action fought by Napoleon in Russia. By withdrawing, the Russian army preserved its combat strength, eventually allowing them to force Napoleon out of the country.

Game allows to play either side and decide about the fate of Napoleon and his conquer of Russia.
93353.name: Borodino 1812

93354.name: Mega Maze (1993)
93354.description:
User Summary
Puzzle game in which the player directs marbles to their destination in a maze. The player controls all the marbles on screen simultaneously, comparable to the familiar wooden maze games.

The game has 75 levels in which the player has to deal with various traps (e.g. lasers, pits, other marbles).

Produced by Bill Tipper. Game and mazes created by Dave Phillips.

93355.description:
These cards can be used with The Talking, Feeling, And Doing Game.
It contains 99 cards and follows the format of the original board game, focusing on specific problem or concerns of children. Like the original game, the card game is sure to help children communicate their feelings and develop insight into their problems.
93355.name: The Talking, Feeling and Doing Divorce Card Game

93356.description:
These cards can be used with The Talking, Feeling, And Doing Game.
It contains 99 cards and follows the format of the original board game, focusing on specific problem or concerns of children. Like the original game, the card game is sure to help children communicate their feelings and develop insight into their problems.
93356.name: The Talking, Feeling & Doing Shyness Card Game

93357.description:
These cards can be used with The Talking, Feeling, And Doing Game.
It contains 99 cards and follows the format of the original board game, focusing on specific problem or concerns of children. Like the original game, the card game is sure to help children communicate their feelings and develop insight into their problems.
93357.name: The Talking, Feeling and Doing Anger Card Game

93358.description:
These cards can be used with The Talking, Feeling, And Doing Game.
It contains 99 cards and follows the format of the original board game, focusing on specific problem or concerns of children. Like the original game, the card game is sure to help children communicate their feelings and develop insight into their problems.
93358.name: Good Behaviour Deck of Cards

93359.description:
These cards can be used with The Talking, Feeling, And Doing Game.
It contains 99 cards and follows the format of the original board game, focusing on specific problem or concerns of children. Like the original game, the card game is sure to help children communicate their feelings and develop insight into their problems.
93359.name: The Talking, Feeling & Doing Teasing Card Game

93360.name: Battles for a Continent
93360.description: Battles for a Continent is a low-complexity, tactical, print-and-play simulation of two Seven Years War (known as the French and Indian War in the United States) battles fought outside the gates of Quebec City: The Plains of Abraham (1759) and Sainte-Foy (1760). Battle scenario designs and OOB research were done by Dennis L. Bishop. Two sets of counters, one 22" x 17" map. The rules include stack disruption, leader effects, defensive fire against melee attacks and more. Included is a separate bonus game: Braddock's Defeat: The Battle of the Monongahela

93361.name: Air Grid 1: Board Maps Basic
93361.description:
From Item Cover

Pack of basic board bases for air combat tabletop gaming.

User Comment

A set of hex and square grid maps with a picture of the sky as a background for in atmosphere combat.

93363.name: Journey to Friendsville
93363.description:
In this game players roll the die to take a trip from the Start space to the town of Friendsville. On the way they will win friends (round tokens) by answering questions. To object of the game is to reach Friendsville and have at least 4 friends.

Components:

Game board,
pawns,
die,
game cards,
round tokens

93364.description:
In Hoc Signo Vinces: The Campaign for Rome, 312 AD is actually 2 games . One game uses an area map to portray the campaign fought in northern and central Italy between the forces of Maxentius and Constantine. Battles between forces in the same area are resolved on a separate "battle board". Rules include omens, differing types of forces, as well as what the Eastern Emperor, Licinius is up to.
The other game is on the climatic battle of the campaign, Milvian Bridge. This uses a hex map and a separate rules section.

Components for IHSV include two 11 by 17 maps, 288 unmounted single-sided counters 1 8.5 by 11 battle board, two sets of rules (16 pages for the campaign game, 6 pages for the Milvian Bridge battle game) and 4 pages of charts/tables/tracks.
93364.name: In Hoc Signo Vinces: The Campaign for Rome, 312 AD
boardgamepodcastepisode: I've Been Diced! episode 46: Paul Rohrbaugh of High Flying Dice Games

93366.name: The Bully Free card game
93366.description:
Based on The Bully Free Classroom by Allan L. Beane, Ph.D., this card game plays like Crazy Eights (players must match an element of the top card of the discard pile to play), so most kids will have some familiarity with the process. The cards are divided into four categories: What Would You Do If...,Self-Esteem Boosters, Ways to Stay Bully Free and Why Should You Do This?
Kids get rid of cards (and move closer to being out, or bully free) by offering reasonable suggestions and responses to questions. Meant to be played with adult supervision (a teacher, counselor, or youth worker familiar with anti-bullying themes).

93368.description:
The Beautiful Game allows you to play the action of a top flight Football (soccer) match. Decisions made at the Team Level by the Manager have to backed up by skill and luck on the field by the players. The Beautiful Game is a complete game where you just have to add the dice, the A3 size pitch and cut out counters representing the players will fit on an average coffee table. Step up to using 15mm players on the pitch or make your own 1:1 scale pitch, the choice is yours.
Play one off games using the teams provided or ones you have designed yourself. Next use the campaign system to see if your team can cut it in a League or Cup competition. The rules let you play every aspect of the modern game, dodgy referee decisions, offside nightmares, goal mouth scrambles, professional fouls, hard men tackles even the crowd support plays a part!

The Beautiful Game comes with a full color 11" x 17" Pitch.
Thirty five 5/8" counters - two full teams plus substitutes
Rules for playing a Cup and League Campaign.
Two sets of player sheets gathering the tables you'll use for the match in one spot.
Two pre-generated teams and rules for building your own.




The game play represents the action one would see in a ‘Highlights’ programme like the definitive BBC ‘Match of the Day’. It plays fast and smooth once the game is learnt so you can concentrate on the action, not on the rules.
93368.name: The Beautiful Game

93369.name: MLB 11: The Show
videogamehonor: 2011 Spike Best Sports Game of the Year Nominee
2012 D.I.C.E. Sports Game of the Year Nominee
93369.description:
The three main new features for 2011 are:

1. Pure Analog Control System, which includes analog controls for hitting, pitching, and throwing, adding more precision and accuracy to all three disciplines.

2. Co-op Mode, which allows up to four-player offline or online cooperative play where gamers can split duties covering either the infield or outfield, while also switching off at the plate or choosing the specific batters they’d like to control.

3. Road to The Show returns in version 5.0 bringing a new interactive slider set to the Create Player process and new training modes triggered by the Player Performance Evaluator.

Source: Wikipedia, "MLB 11 the show", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

93370.name: Madeline at the White House
93370.description:
Madeline at the White House Game is the first in a series of active games from Briarpatch that encourage the players to get up and move…they have to, they are the game pieces!
Players visit landmarks of Washington on their flying carpets. The first player to visit them all is the winner. Sturdy landmark plaques and durable spinner allow for play indoors or out.

Contains 8 landmarks, 4 flying carpets, spinner, rules for different ways to play and Madeline’s Guide to Washington! For ages 4 and up; 2 – 4 players

The game was released to celebrate the arrival of the newest Madeline book of the same name, Madeline at the White House.

93371.name: Men of War: Assault Squad
93371.description:
User Summary:
MoW:AS is a tactical RTS where one can play as Russia, the US, Germany, Britian, or Japan in WW2 battles. The game has single player skirmishes, online coop and multiplayer battles. The main focus of this iteration is on the coop battles where players have limited units to attack and take over points on the map that unlock more powerful units and equipment.

93372.name: Madeline in Paris Game
93372.description:
Join Madeline in a race through Paris as she hunts for Genevieve's lost pups. A perfect first board game for young Madeline fans.

Includes rules for cooperative and competitive play. No reading required. Develops skills of decision making, memory/matching, visual interpretation and social development.

Contents: Game board, 4 Madeline playing figures with bases, 15 game tokens, rules for two ways to play, a brief guide to Madeline's Paris

--from the publisher

The objective is to circle the board, and in the process to match pictures. The gameplay is comparable to Candyland.

93373.name: Men of War: Vietnam
93373.description:
Men of War: Vietnam is a new game in the critically acclaimed series. Two new, story-driven campaigns let you taste the explosive mix of the jungle, Hueys and rock-n-roll in early 1968.

The US campaign focuses on a team of elite special ops soldiers, and each one of them has a personality. The unit includes Sergeant John Merrill, machinegunner Jim Walsh, sniper Sonny Armstrong, grenade launcher operator Carl Dillan and combat engineer Bill Kirby. In some missions they can count only on themselves, while in the others they act together with regular US and South-Vietnamese troops.

The North Vietnam campaign tells the story of two Soviet military consultants and two soldiers of the North Vietnam Army who are the only survivors of an ambush prepared by the US troops. The task of getting back to the North Vietnam territory is a difficult one, they have no means of radio communication, no wheeled vehicles, and it’s too far to make it there on foot. On their way these survivors get involved in a chain of bloodbath engagements and find themselves in the dead center of the well-known Tet offensive.

Missions range from special operations to full scale battles.

Key features:

* There are two sides in every story, so two new story-driven campaigns attempt to show the war from both sides.
* Breathtaking missions including an ambush on the Ho Chi Minh trail, a game of cat and mouse in the Mekong Delta, raids into Cambodia and Laos, bridge defense during the Tet offensive and more.
* New weapons and units: M-16, T-54, M-113, Patton III, M-60, AK-47, M-14, RPG-2, M-72 LAW, RPK and many more.
* Multiplayer mode, co-op for up to 4 players.

Source: The Publisher Website.

93375.name: Madeline Matching Game
93375.description:
Specially designed for fun-lovers on the go! The Madeline Matching Game features artwork from the beloved Madeline books. Comes in a beautifully designed carry bag...Games to Go!

No reading required. Builds memory/matching and social skills.

Contents: Carry-along cloth drawstring bag, 36 tiles, rules for multiple games to play

--publisher

Play Four Games With This Set Of Illustrated Madeline Tiles: Madeline fans can now play the classic concentration game of memory match with a Madeline twist. Featuring illustrations from classic Madeline books, this set includes 36 high quality Madeline matching tiles and directions for four memory games including the traditional version, a cooperative version, a version for beginners and an imaginative story telling version.

93376.name: I SPY Ready to Read Game
93376.description:
Let’s get ready to read with I SPY! See the riddle on your game board and find the color highlighted object in the I SPY picture…children identify the word and the picture of the object to begin their learning-to-read journey. Punch out the tokens then play the game in reverse by finding the match and putting it back in the proper place in the riddle. Many fun activities included to help capture children’s focus and interest. Four ways to play.

Game-play has players read the riddle on their gameboard, find the objects the riddle refers to, and punch them out. The game can be played in reverse by reading the riddles, naming the objects, and placing them back into your board.

Contains 6 double-sided game boards, 24 double-sided tokens, rules for several ways to play. For ages 4 and up, 1-6 players.

93377.name: Super Dodge Ball Advance
93377.description:
Super Dodge Ball Advance, released in Japan as Bakunetsu Dodgeball Fighters (爆熱ドッジボールファイターズ, "Bakunetsu" meaning "Burning Heat"), dodge ball game based on the Super Dodge Ball. While based on the original Super Dodge Ball series, the game does not feature the Kunio-kun characters from the original game due to copyrights issues, as developer Million did not obtain the rights to the Kunio-kun characters until the following year. However, the game uses a remixed version of opening and ending songs from Technos Japan Corp's Super Dodge Ball games.

Source: Wikipedia, "Super Dodge Ball Advance", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

93378.name: I SPY Spectacular
93378.description:
20 years ago, Jean Marzollo and Walter Wick created the first title in their bestselling I Spy series, I Spy: A Book of Picture Riddles. What's a 20th anniversary without a "wow" kind of game? Introducing I Spy Spectacular, a one-of-a-kind game with a 3-tiered spinner that will send you over the edge looking for picture matches. To celebrate the 20th anniversary of the I Spy series, new riddles from Jean Marzollo are paired with 13 of Walter Wick's photographs from the classic I Spy vault to create a spectacular search-and-find game.

I Spy Spectacular Game is a matching game that centers around a 3-level spinner with cards to match the items on the spinner complete with I Spy's trademark riddles. This game contains one three-level spinner, which when spun locks into place one level at a time for hundreds of possible combinations of items on the spinner. The 36 double sided cards have a different combination of items on each one. Every spin will have a card to match one of the combinations it produces. Kids scramble to be the first to find a match and score 1 of the 50 score chips. The rules cotain more than one game play depending on the age group playing.

And don't forget the riddles that become a fun and creative activity at the end of the round.

93379.name: Pocket Bomberman
93379.description:
Pocket Bomberman (ポケットボンバーマン) is a platforming action game first released for the Game Boy in 1997, and later for the Game Boy Color in 1998.

Pocket Bomberman features gameplay that revolves around using bombs to box in enemies and blowing them to bits. Once all enemies are defeated, Bomberman has to go to the door at the end of the stage to complete the level. There is a total of 5 worlds and 25 levels. These worlds include a jungle world, an ocean world, a wind world, a cloud world, and a world with the name of "Evil". Each world has a boss fight at the end in which Bomberman must expose the bosses weak points and bomb the boss until it has no health left.

Source: Wikipedia, "Pocket Bomberman", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

93380.name: HackJournal (Issue 9 - Feb 2004)
rpgissuearticle: All Things Magical - Nebula Quick-Casting Battle Harness
Butterflieds are Free! (Or at Least Reasonably Priced)
A Day in the Life of a Dungeon Cat
Focus on STP's: Clarifying the Skills, Talents, and Proficiencies of the Class Books
Frequently Asked Questions about Hackmaster - Today's Topic: The Monk
We Know What Was Missing: Cantrips for the Young Diviner
93380.description:
The cover issue number is HackJournal 4.09.

The first only-electronic version of HackJournal, provided in PDF for HMGMA in good standing.

The table of contents is detailed in the Article list below.

93381.name: HackJournal (Issue 10 - Apr 2004)
rpgissuearticle: A Day in the Life of a Thelia'regis
93381.description:
The cover issue number is HJ 4.10.

The table of contents is detailed in the Article list below.

93382.name: HackJournal (Issue 11 - Jul 2004)
rpgissuearticle: A Day in the Life... Aarakian
Demi-Human Class Restrictions and Level Limitations
Grunsch: Capital of The Gnome Alliance of the Waylands
93382.description:
The cover issue number is HJ 4.11.

The table of contents is detailed in the Article list below.

93383.name: Transbot
93383.description:
TransBot is a video game for the Sega Master System originally released in 1986. It is a sci-fi-themed shoot 'em up inspired by Transformers.

Source: Wikipedia, "TransBot", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

93384.name: Astro Warrior
93384.description:
The game is a basic top down shooter that was common at the time, similar to Zanac for the NES. The game plays through three levels with a boss at the end of each. Astro Warrior's three levels each have many different kinds of enemies that attack in various patterns. The stages themselves have no obstacles. Like most shooters, learning the enemies' patterns and how best to deal with them is the key to success in Astro Warrior. Also as important is collecting power-ups, which can be accomplished by shooting at targets on the ground. These power-ups are vital to the game as it is almost unplayable without them, especially the speed-ups. Without speed-ups, your ship moves way too slowly to do much of anything. The other power-ups include a stronger laser weapon and two Gradius-style options.

Source: Wikipedia, "Astro Warrior", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

93386.name: Ayrton Senna's Super Monaco GP II
93386.description:
Ayrton Senna's Super Monaco GP II is an arcade-style Formula One racing video game developed and manufactured by Sega. It is the follow-up to Super Monaco GP, and is sometimes referred to as in its abbreviated form as Super Monaco GP 2, however this is not an official title. The game was released for the Sega Master System, Sega Mega Drive, and the Sega Game Gear, appearing in the United States on 16 July 1992, Japan on 17 July 1992, and sometime later in 1992 in Europe. Along with boasting the most "realistic physics" of any console driving game at the time of release, the game was also endorsed by the then Formula One champion Ayrton Senna. The game's development was also assisted by Senna, who supplies his own advice about the tracks featured in the game.

Source: Wikipedia, "Ayrton Senna's Super Monaco GP II", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

93387.name: Multi10 Core Rules
93387.description:
From the PDF Introduction
Multi10 is a simple, universal roleplaying system designed with contemporary or science fiction settings in mind; it can do fantasy but it wasn’t built to accommodate truly heroic/superhuman settings. Its name is directly derived from the dice mechanic it uses to resolve actions. Multi10 uses d10-based dice pools, rolling a number of dice equal to your attribute and multiplying the highest-scoring die by your skill rating to generate an action score. Most similar systems simply add the attribute and the skill rating together to calculate the size of the dice pool, but the multiplication twist makes skills quite important and prevents players from simply focusing on attributes to get large dice pools. A system of specialties that allows for high character customization further builds on this simple premise. Combat is fast, mostly realistic and deadly. The ability to perform quick or slow-but-precise attacks and spread actions over multiple phases adds a tactical element to battles without resorting to long and cumbersome lists of special actions and manoeuvres.

93388.name: Multi10 Character Record Sheet
93388.description:
User Summary
This is a blank character sheet made for the Multi10 system.

93389.name: Linkology: Animals
93389.description: The Linkology game is a fast and fun card game that links science concepts together in a way that reinforces vocabulary and classification skills. The deck of 100 self-checking cards contains word cards and beautifully illustrated photo cards. Each player starts with a hand of 5 cards. One card starts the discard pile. On your turn, try to find a card in your hand that shares an attribute with the top card of the discard pile. For example, if the word card "bone" is on the discard pile, you could play the picture card of "skull" from your hand. If you don't have a match, you must draw a card to add to your hand. If you're the first person with an empty hand, you win.

93390.name: Linkology: Solar System
93390.description: The Linkology game is a fast and fun card game that links science concepts together in a way that reinforces vocabulary and classification skills. The deck of 100 self-checking cards contains word cards and beautifully illustrated photo cards. Each player starts with a hand of 5 cards. One card starts the discard pile. On your turn, try to find a card in your hand that shares an attribute with the top card of the discard pile. For example, if the word card "bone" is on the discard pile, you could play the picture card of "skull" from your hand. If you don't have a match, you must draw a card to add to your hand. If you're the first person with an empty hand, you win.

93391.name: Linkology: Human Body
93391.description: The Linkology game is a fast and fun card game that links science concepts together in a way that reinforces vocabulary and classification skills. The deck of 100 self-checking cards contains word cards and beautifully illustrated photo cards. Each player starts with a hand of 5 cards. One card starts the discard pile. On your turn, try to find a card in your hand that shares an attribute with the top card of the discard pile. For example, if the word card "bone" is on the discard pile, you could play the picture card of "skull" from your hand. If you don't have a match, you must draw a card to add to your hand. If you're the first person with an empty hand, you win.

93394.name: Tonka: Rescue Patrol
93394.description:
Join Tonka Joe patrolling the town rescuing those in need. Use classic Tonka construction vehicles to rebuild buildings and prevent natural disasters.

Source: The Publisher Website.

93395.name: NHRA 2005 Championship Drag Racing
93395.description:
Take on NHRA World Champions John Force, Tony Schumacher, Greg Anderson, and other top drivers, in real nitro-burning NHRA Funny Car, Top Fuel Dragster & Pro Stock racing action! Fine tune your 7000 hp beast to battle your way to the front of the standings, competing one race or one full season at a time. Do you think you have what it takes to become a champion?

Source: The Publisher Website.

93396.name: Matchbox Emergency Patrol
93396.description:
Chase down criminals as a heroic police officer or battle blazes as a daring firefighter. Turn your siren on and watch traffic pull aside as you speed through Matchbox County. Watch for shortcuts as you complete 24 different missions to become the fire or police chief.

Source: The Publisher Website.

93397.name: BattleTanx
93397.description:
There are three tanks in the game for the player to choose from. The player can choose between a Moto Tank, M1A1 Abrams MBT, or the Goliath. There are 17 levels to complete in order to finish the single player game, all of which are filled with enemy tanks. Each level is located in a specific place in the United States, such as New York City, Chicago, Las Vegas, and San Francisco the game features most environments destructible as well as interactive in some cases.

In the game's multiplayer mode, players can battle with up to 4 players simultaneously. There are four different multiplayer configurations; Battlelord mode (equivalent to capture the flag), Deathmatch, Family Mode, and Annihilation.


Battlelord Capture the opponent's Queenlords.
Deathmatch The first to seven kills win.
Family Mode Deathmatch, but ammo cannot be switched, only used up.
Annihilation provides each competitor with five tanks, last survivor wins.


Source: Wikipedia, "BattleTanx", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

93398.name: Hot Wheels Turbo Racing
93398.description:
The focus of the game is racing one of a selection of cars through various themed tracks. Secret tracks can be accessed by winning and new cars can be used by finding the 'new car' bonuses hidden in each stage.

As seen in the hint screens, using the controller to perform various stunts from jumping off points gains 'turbos' which allow short bursts of speed. The car in use will take damage based on running into obstacles or other players. Icons found around the track give differing performance enhancements.

The game requires a memory card in order to save progress.

Source: Wikipedia, "Hot Wheels Turbo Racing", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

93399.name: Brunswick Pro Bowling
93399.description:
Brunswick Pro Bowling is the only game to feature a realistic and authentic bowling experience while showcasing jaw-dropping ball and pin physics. Strap on the wrist guard and roll on accurate oil patterns, earn tons of trophies, and unlock hidden items on your way to winning the world championship. Customize your bowler with genuine Brunswick equipment from bowling balls, shoes, and clothing. Whether you're a casual player or a bowling fanatic, Brunswick Pro Bowling is fun for all ages and provides hours of entertainment for the whole family!

Source: The Game Website.

93400.description:
"The fasten-ating railway game where the trains are stationery"

In Paperclip Railways, players initially lay out a fantasy landscape in which to build railway stations; these stations give in- and end-game bonuses and are connected by customizable lengths of track made from paperclips!

Players score for the stations they build from and to, and for how long their railway links are and, at the end of the game, for various achievements. The player with the most victory points is declared the winner.
93400.name: Paperclip Railways

93401.description:
The Rivals for Catan: Age of Darkness, a 90-card expansion for The Rivals for Catan, includes three separate theme sets that can be used with the base game:

• The Era of Intrigue – You will witness the confrontation of followers of new and old beliefs and take part to determine Catan's spiritual balance. "Religious Dispute" causes both players to lose cards; Churches and Temples minimize losses; Temple cards strengthen your access to your own draw stacks. Church cards lure opposing heroes and earn gold. With a Church and a Temple, you may build the Great Thing stead and end the conflict.

• The Era of Merchant Princes – Using the "Commercial Harbor" and the "Merchant's Residences", decisive buildings in the struggle for trade advantage, players try to control Catan's commerce. "Maritime Trade Monopolies" and the "Master Merchants" enhance trade ships. "The Shipbuilder" reduces the building costs of ships. Dominate trade using clever card combinations!

• The Era of Barbarians – Use Castles, Border Fortresses, the Strategist, the Caravel, and new heroes to fend off both the barbarian attacks and your rival's efforts to dominate your holdings.
93401.name: The Rivals for Catan: Age of Darkness
boardgamefamily: Die Fürsten von Catan / The Rivals for Catan

93402.description:
Kart sur Glace is a finger-flicking race game inspired by Micromachines and Mario Kart. The speedway is created by placing objects on the table: plates, forks, glasses, books, other games, cats, etc. Players each simultaneously choose a card that gives them action points. Each action allows you to make:

• one finger-flick at the rear of your car, or
• one reorientation of your car, or
• the playing of one bonus card: missile, flask of oil, dynamite, etc.

Each time you pass through a checkpoint, you draw a bonus card. The goal, of course, is to be the first to cross the finish line.
93402.name: Kart sur Glace

93403.name: Lizardfolk of the Dragon Fang
93403.description:
From the book:
Deep in the heart of a forbidding swamp, the lizardfolk of the Dragon Fang tribe beat the drums of war. Lead by Sesskarr the Great, a mighty and charismatic lizard king with a tyrant's heart and a black dragon's blood, the Dragon Fang tribe is aggressively expanding beyond their traditional tribal boundaries. Groups of kobolds and troglodytes are all said to have fallen before Sesskarr’s great trident and now- even more ominously - his reptilian gaze has shifted to the surrounding towns and villages.

Lizardfolk of the Dragon Fang presents four new feats, four new spells and three new magic items all useable by members of the tribe. Additionally, it contains thirteen stat blocks (ranging in CR from 1-11) as well as full details of the tribe’s key members, including the lizard king himself. The lizardfolk of the Dragon Fang can appear in almost any setting and are compatible with The Lonely Coast (a free 30 page, extensively bookmarked PDF available from ragingswan.com).

93404.name: Zoo 3000
93404.description:
Card game where the players create their own zoo. These zoos don´t consist of "ordinary zoo-animals", instead there are for example aliens, monsters, ghosts and wherewulfes.

The game mechanics is very simple. You start with some cards in your hand, and there are cards of four different kinds.Different colours on the back sides of the cards. Different families, but within each family the cards have different values. Each familiy (group of cards) are placed faced down in four different piles. On your turn you discard one card from your hand and take one card from the pile of that family. Then you try to get cards with as much value as possible, and the player with the best total value (points) wins the game.

93405.name: Nöjesfältet
93405.description:
A card game with dice, where the players create their own amusement parks.

There are five different groups of cards with amusement park attractions.The player in turn plays one card with an attraction of a particular group and the other players have to follow with a card of the same group or pass. The card indicate how strong it is. Mostly the player has to roll a number of dice. When none wants to play more cards of that group, it is closed and it is checked who reached most points of that group. After that, it continues in the same way with next player playing a card of another group. Every group is worth a particular number of points, and there is also a bonus for having won most groups. The player with the most points win the game.

93406.name: Snake :) A Sock Puppet's Adventure
93406.description:
User Summary

In this take of the classic "Snake" game, you control a sock puppet called Sockie, whose only goal in life is to eat balls of yarn, which makes him longer. The balls have different colours, making Sockie striped in new patters every time you play.

The game has two different control schemes and 3 different difficulties.

93407.name: Stick Golf
videogamehonor: 2012 CVA Best Game on the Go Nominee
2012 CVA Best Indie Game of the Year Nominee
93407.description:
Not just another golf game. Highly addictive 2D golf platformer. Drive, chip and putt your way through 144 holes on 16 unique courses, and unlock hidden features! Over 1,000,000 downloads!

Source: The Developer Website.

93408.name: e-Publishing Secrets
93408.description:
From the book's introduction

The shocking truth about starting your own RPG Company

The first version of this PDF was only two pages long.

That’s right. Originally this "secret tell-all" was just a gag. "How do you save money starting an RPG company? Don’t start one." It came from an instant messenger conversation with one of my RPG publishing partners. We both got a chuckle over it. Then, as happens with all bad ideas, somewhere along the way I started taking it seriously. Now you’re reading the result. Just for the record, I do stand by the advice on the previous page. The single best way to save hundreds, if not thousands, of dollars and probably hundreds of irretrievable hours of your life is to avoid the publishing flypaper trap.

Even though this began as a joke, the advice on the following pages is dead serious. I’m sharing with you 10 pieces of advice I firmly believe every potential publisher should know before taking the plunge.

While the advice on the previous page would save you a lot of time and money, we both know you’re not going to take it - and I would feel bad if you did. If you are serious about publishing, then the advice on the following pages will help you avoid certain pitfalls and set you on a path to publishing titles of which you can be proud.

93409.name: Jellyfish Jam
93409.description:
User Summary

In Jellyfish Jam you play a Goldfish named Sammy. He will swim around the ocean eating as much pineapple as possible. When he eats a pineapple, a jellyfish appears. Your goal is guide Sammy while tilting your phone, in order to each as many pineapples as possible, while not touching any of the jellyfish.

93410.name: Voldaria: The Midlands (Map Set)
93410.description:
From the product

For use with all fantasy role-playing games.

Poster size player & GM maps for Voldaria Midlands. Maps detail the location of various cities, towns, and towers by size, plus roads, rivers, bridges, waterfalls, etc. This map is supported by AoV Kingdoms, AoV Dungeons and "Volondar: The City" maps sets. (Over 100 unique Castle & Dungeon Floor plans.)

Introduction

This map set is designed for use with all fantasy role-playing game systems where travel out of doors is required or desired. To get from one place to another most people need to know where they are, and where they are going. Since the dawn of time, intelligent creatures have used maps for this purpose. The Midlands map set of Voldaria, details a little over one million square miles of terrain. (Eight 8x10 color drawings to form two 16x20 inch regional maps.)

The player's map depicts the location of major cities, roads, rivers, bridges, landmarks, and unusual terrain features. The GM's map also includes hidden cities, isolated places, and the entrance location to several dozen dungeons. Several different icons are used on maps to denote size and type of city, fortress, temple, tower or dungeon. Icons used are not in scale with map, but intentionally enlarged to allow players and GM to quickly see what is where.

93411.description:
Extension for Killpower Ball
French Version

- 80 new powers with 79 new illustrations and a QUIDAULT Pascal Josselin Grange.
- Powers adapted to the rules in 2.1 or 2.0
- New powers to double the lifespan of the game
- Powers always original and never redundant: Create mountains, freeze your enemies, cancel the score, starting with the ball ....
- With the base game, you will have a total of 160 power and 43 680 possible combinations to create a random team (considering that eels powers and failing damage and increased protections that have the number of combinations to infinity) .
93411.name: Pack 1: Sylvania

93412.description:
Extension for Killpower Ball
French version

- Fate in the game with 100 possible cases.
- Reviews with more than 240 possible cases.
- 5 new races (clone, pygmy, Amazon, Dwarf, Zombie) with their special abilities.
- Rules on the master
- Money: A new way of managing his team with a risk of losing it if mismanagement of his bank account.
- The Rules 2.1
- Sell Sheet and team in 2.1
93412.name: Killpower Ball, Extension 1: Destin, Critiques et Fric

93414.name: Myst 10th Anniversary DVD Edition
93414.description:
Collection includes Myst Masterpiece, Riven, and Myst III: Exile

Game Features

First Myst compilation available on DVD format: Great for collectors, includes full game versions of Myst Masterpiece, Riven, and Myst III: Exile.
Re-engineered to be fully XP compatible.
Includes exclusive 10th anniversary interview with Rand Miller, as well as footage from the making of Myst III: Exile and Riven.
All three games on DVD are both PC and Mac® compatible.
Special 10th anniversary packaging.




Source: The Publisher Website.

93416.name: Star Farm
93416.description:
Star Farm is the newest 3-D farming game you can play on the go! Command your Star Farmer to plant, fertilize, and harvest a variety of amazing crops on your very own Martian farm!

BEAUTIFUL 3-D GRAPHICS
Play the BEST farming game in 3-D!

STELLAR SOUNDTRACK
Listen to the Star Farm soundtrack while you farm or play your own music

GROW CROPS AND LEVEL UP Earn water and experience to unlock exciting new plants Fertilize your crops to accelerate their growth.

Source: The Developer Website.

93417.name: Squarbles
93417.description:
Square Marbles

Players use a spring-loaded plastic "shooter" to launch their plastic Squarbles as close to the "target" Squarble as possible. After all shots have been made, each Squarble within a certain distance (the length of the plastic "shooter") score points.

93418.name: The Arrival
93418.description:
The Arrival is a 1996 science fiction film directed by David Twohy and starring Charlie Sheen, and co-starring Lindsay Crouse, Richard Schiff, Ron Silver, and Teri Polo. Sheen stars as radio astronomer Zane Zaminski who discovers evidence of intelligent alien life and quickly gets thrown into the middle of a conspiracy that turns his life upside down.

Source: Wikipedia, "The Arrival (film)", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

User Summary

The game is a sequel to the original film. You have been kidnapped by the aliens, and must now escape across the diverse lands of an alien planet. This is an adventure game from a first person perspective with puzzles.

93419.name: ZauberZeit (Issue 1  - Sep 1986)
93419.description:
(user summary)

table of contents:

Das Geheimnis des Flußtmepels - scenario for D&D, AD&D, MERP, Rolemaster
Die Traumhändler von Havena - scenario for DSA

Klein aber Oho - on adventure playbooks
Die Black Priests - a club
Der Schrö - a strange monster
Drachenkämpfer - new rules
Heinzelmännchens Bücherstube - a merchant
D&D/AS&D Monster conversion to Midgard

Michael Moorcock - portrait

book and games reviews

93420.name: ZauberZeit (Issue 2 - Nov/Dec 1986)
93420.description:
(user summmary)
table of contents:

Interview with Gary Chalk
book and games revies
Drachenkämpfer - miniature rules
Anne MacCaffrey - portrait
Auf der Suche nach dem unkundigen Leser - strange solo adventure

Das große Kamelrennen von Mish Moia - scenario for AD&D, DSA, Rolemaster, Midgard
Auch ein Drache bracht mal Hilfe - D&D scenario

93421.name: Space Rangers 2: Reboot
93421.description:
User Summary

Space Rangers 2: Rise of the Dominators is back, and with a few improvements. Reboot is a stand alone expansion, which includes the original Space Rangers 2 with new maps, new units, new graphics, and game play elements.

Source: The Publisher Website.

Overview
Future. We write the year 3300. Our galaxy is invaded by dominators, the combat robots that lost control under influence of Klissan technologies. A coalition of five allied races: Maloqs, Pelengs, Humans, Faeyans and Gaalians stakes on space rangers called up to root out dominators.

The player becomes a ranger, selects a race, and gets a space ship and necessary equipment. Since that moment he finds himself in a real world of rangers which does not exist in any other computer game where he can engage in all possible types of activities: fight in the space or the hyperspace, buy and sell goods, accomplish government tasks, liberate planets from dominators in 3D battles and, of course, play text quests each of them being a separate game.

It is impossible to foresee the development of events. The game may finish with a victory of either side or last endlessly. Everything depends on actions of the player and dwellers of this live and developing world where you can live a life of a wicked pirate as well as that of a glorious hero able to make out the origins of dominators’ onset and put an end to this bloody war.

Features

5 new text quests!
27 new maps for planetary battles!
10 new maps for hyperspace battles.
New government tasks.
New equipment and unique hull designs, including three super spaceships.
New game modes: step-by-step progress through text quests and planetary battles.
Expanded interface of ship’s hold and information center.
More than 50 new governmental tasks of different types.
New unique equipment.
Galaxy search system improved.

93422.name: Rrootage
93422.description:
rRootage is a shoot 'em up viewed from a top-down perspective, comprised solely of boss battles against large abstract spacecraft attacking the player with intricate barrages of projectiles. The game featured multiple modes: "normal", "Psy", "Ika" and "GW"; the latter three inspired by Psyvariar, Ikaruga and Giga Wing, respectively.
Source: Wikipedia, "ABA Games", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

Developer website description: "Control your ship and avoid the barrage. Use the laser gun to destroy the battleship of the enemy."
Source: The Game Website.

93423.name: Halloween Party
93423.description: The game consists of 71 tiles. 56 sweets tiles and 16 monster tiles. The tiles are all put on the table face down. On each player´s turn he reveals one of the tiles on the table. If it is a sweets tile the player has two options. Either take the tile, put it in front of him and the next player takes his turn or continue revealing tiles unil he chooses o stop. He than colects all revealed tiles and the next player takes his turn. If at any time a reveald tile shows a monster the active payer´s turn ends and the next player collects al the revealed sweets tiles. Than that player starts his turn with revealing at least one tile. This continues until all 16 monster tiles have been reveald. The player with the most tiles win the game.

93424.name: Signs & Portents (Issue 3 - Oct 2003)
rpgissuearticle: Conan Roleplaying in the Hyborean Age
Why I Probably Won't Be Writing For Babylon 5
93424.description:
Table of Contents:

10, Q&A
12, Gaming Symposium: Beyond the Cut Out by Shannon Kalvar
18, Nothing But Trouble? by Lizard
22, The 3.5 Witch by Robert Schwalb
30, Conan: Roleplaying in the Hyborian Age by Ian Sturrock
36, What Does This Button Do? by August Hahn
40, Ultimate Gameplay: The Urban Wilderness by Shannon Kalvar
43 Interview with a Writer? August Hahn
46, The Pak'Ma'Ra by Lizard
50, Creature Feature! by Johnathan M. Richards
56, Get Your Motor Running by Marc Farrimond
61, Why I Probably Won't Be Writing for Babylon 5 by Jonny Nexus
62, The Vengeance of Maeloun by Ian Sturrock

93425.name: Waldemars Gartenspiel
93425.description: The game consists of 72 tiles showing either plants, the sun or a watering can. Each player has his own "garden" (a small gameboard) in front of him. The players have to complete their garden with 4 sun tiles, 4 water tiles and 8 different plant tiles. They colect tiles from the middle of the table with a special die. The first player to complete his garden wins the game.

93426.name: Battle Squadron
93426.description:
Battle Squadron is a vertically scrolling shooter for the Amiga computer platform and the Sega Genesis console, for one or two players. It is a sequel to Hybris.

Taking place many years in the future in another star system, a century long war is waging between the Earth Defense Fleet and the Barrax Empire. Two Earth Defense Commanders, Lori Bergin and Barry Mayers, were returning from a research and destroy mission regarding the latest Barrax technologies on planet Urania, when suddenly a Barrax cruiser materialized behind them, brought their ship in and took the commanders hostage on planet Terrainia. The player's mission is to rescue the Commanders and eliminate all Barrax threats in the process.

Battle Squadron supports both mouse- and joystick-controlled styles of play. Players play the game from the perspective of elite fighter pilots of the Earth Defense Fleet, known as the Battle Squadron sent to rescue two human agents, Commanders Berry D. Mayers and Lori Bergin, from the clutches of the ruthless alien empire, known as the Barrax. The player's fighters carry unlimited projectile weaponry and a finite number of Nova Smart Bombs.

Notable features of the game are relatively big sprites (with Predator-esque cloaking effects applied to a few) and numerous weapon upgrades (supposedly 25 in total). Barraxian opponents consist of ground installations (generally gun turrets and launch platforms), ground vehicles, aircraft and numerous genetically-engineered living weapons.

Specific enemies of note include:

Cargo vehicles that drop weapon upgrades upon destruction.
Four-craft squadrons of Barrax fighters that will release an extra, collectable Nova Bomb upon destruction of the entire squadron.
Two different varieties of gigantic, apparently-robotic terror machines, functioning as the bosses of two separate levels.
What appear to be several giant faces in the terrain, once again, serving as end-of-level bosses.
The Barrax Nova Cruiser, the end-game boss.




Source: Wikipedia, "Battle Squadron", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

93427.name: Let's communicate!
93427.description: This is a party game similar to Activity. There are hundreds of words or phrases players have to find out. The active player has to discribe, draw or "explain in pantomime" and the others have to find out what he is discribing. Since this is a game by "Deutsche Telecom" all the words have to do with communication.

93428.name: stern Wissensquiz: die sechziger Jahre
93428.description: This quiz game is for 2-4 players or teams. The questions are all about the sixties. The nice twist in this game is that all players including the player who asked the question put a token (with the answer they think is the correct one) in the middle. Than they are all revealed and the questioner gets points according to the number of righ answers. 4 correct answers gives him 1 point, 3 give 2 points, 2 give 3 points and 1 correct answer gives him 4 points.

93429.name: Dallas
93429.description:
This game collection comes in an gatefold sleeve like for vinyl records. It contains 3 games:

1.) Dallas-Dominoe: a standard domino game but instead of numbers the two sides of the tiles have the portraits of some Dallas characters.

2.) Dallas-Memo: a standard memory game with pairs of portraits of some Dallas characters.

3.) Dallas-Bluff: the 32 cards are dealt between the players. The first player puts one of his cards face down on the table in front of him and says wich of the Ewings that is. The next player either believes him and puts a different Ewing card face down in front of him or he doesn´t believe him and says so. If he was right the player that lied about his card receives a card from each player. If he was wrong he gets the cards himself. The first player to get rid of all his cards wins.

All cards for the games have portrait pictures of the main characters of the the TV-series "Dallas".

93430.description:
“We will prevail because we are the strongest” French Prime Minister Edouard Dalladier, September 1939.

The West, May 1940. After the fall of Poland the French and British are preparing themselves to face a new, bold kind of war: “Blitzkrieg”.

Supreme Commander Marshall Gamelin is confident he can hold back the German armies long enough to give its army time to re-equip and prepare.

With the Franco-German border solidly defended by the fortified Maginot line, he develops an aggressive plan: the allies will race North to meet the enemy in Belgium and Holland, and stop it cold on the Dyle-Breda line.

Only the Germans have chosen an unexpected, almost scandalous plan: its aim is nothing else than the utter destruction of the whole allied army by breaking through the “impassable” Ardennes Forest, further to the South.

The attack through the Low Lands is an immense feint, aimed at luring the French and British armies North and trap them.

Then begins an implacable race against the clock, as panzer spearheads emerge to the south of the allied armies and run at breakneck speed to the sea. The Allied High command watches horrified the panzer columns emerging on its back. The nervous German High Command is every bit as worried that its spearheads might get isolated and shattered.

Can the armored tide can be stemmed, or is defeat all but assured?

Blitz 1940 is a new Conflict of Heroes game that depicts the western campaign of May-June 1940. It pits the French, British, Belgian and Dutch armies against their arch-enemy, Germany. The battles take place in plains, forests, cities, airfields, in the skies and on the seashore!

Players are presented with the same tactical dilemmas and decisions that commanders faced during some of the most ferocious engagements of WWII.

Conflict of Heroes (CoH) follows the evolution of modern tactics, from WWII to the present. CoH features a fast and fluid system that is easy to learn, but realistic for every unique theater of battles portrayed.

• Fun: Quick simultaneous play allows players to interact without waiting.
• Easy: Teach a new player how to play in under 5 minutes. No charts!
• Historically Accurate: Portrays realistic forces and tactics.
• Units: Depict individual vehicles, airplanes, boats, guns and squads.
• Consistent: Each game in the series uses the same rule system.

Blitz 1940 includes:
4 - 15x19 inch geomorphic mounted map boards that integrate with the maps of all other CoH games.
280 - LARGE 1” square counters that include infantry, tanks, guns, aircraft an even ships.
2 - player summary sheets, customized plastic counter storage tray,
32 page firefight book with a full historical overview and 16+ firefights.
A rule book organized to lead in the player through the rules, with plenty of examples.

Blitz 1940 is an original game and does not require any other Conflict of Heroes game to be played.
93430.name: Conflict of Heroes: Blitzkrieg – France and the Lowlands 1940

93431.name: Kreuz und quer durch Europa
93431.description: In this game the players travel through europe from city to city answering questions about the destination city to collect the city cards. They have to travel on different vehicles like plane or ship according to the route they take.

93432.name: Mach was draus!
93432.description:
This game is about recycling the different types of waste like glass, paper or plastic. It shows the ways of the waste through the recycling process.
The players buy goods in a supermarket or collect it "on the street" wile moving their pawn (a nice truck you night know from "Auf Achse") and than have to recycle the waste. On the game board their are different places where players have to dispose their waste but each of the recycling centers takes only one kind of waste. The more waste of the same type is disposed at once the more points the players receive.

93433.name: Das große Spiel
93433.description: This game is a nice variant of the game Memory. When you reveal two same cards you can either continue like in the normal game of memory or you can risk your points on a scoring track with fields like ×1 (times one), ×2 (times two) or 0 (zero). The roll of a die shows how many steps you go and the field you move to shows the points you then get.

93434.name: Flipper
93434.description: Flipper is a simple dice rolling and move game. Very similar to Pachisi, players roll dice to move their pieces around the board. Unlike in Pachisi, a player does not have to go all the way around the board, but may hit a shortcut to the center exactly and than move meet Flipper in the middle.

93435.name: Milky Way Sternenwelt-Spiel
93435.description: Milky Way is a simple roll and move game with the Milky Way theme. Players move around the board and collect Milky cards whenever they land on one of the special fields.

93436.name: Zany Golf
93436.description:
Zany Golf, also known as Will Harvey's Zany Golf, is a video game with a fantasy take on miniature golf. The game is played in a 3D isometric viewpoint and allows up to 4 players. Zany Golf is a version of mini golf with some features that are impossible in real, physical mini golf. Zany Golf only consists of half a golf course, i.e. 9 holes, although there is a bonus hole.

At the beginning of the first hole, all players are given five strokes. On completing each hole, the remaining players are given more strokes equal to the par of the next hole. If a player runs out of strokes, he or she is eliminated and the other players are allowed to continue. The game ends when all players are eliminated or when the last hole is completed, and the scorecard is displayed.

Source: Wikipedia, "Zany Golf", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

93437.name: Signs & Portents (Issue 4 - Nov 2003)
rpgissuearticle: Conan Roleplaying in the Hyborean Age
Now You See It...Now You Don't
93437.description:
Table of Contents:

6, Q&A by Bob Roberts
12, Hail to the Chief by Lizard
16, OGL Cybernet by August Hahn
24, The Phat Hog 2089 Roadtest by Max Fernandez, Griff Petersen and Lars Koenig
28, More Most Wanted: P.J. Maybe by Matt Sharp
30, Gaming Symposium: The Structure of Evil by Shannon Kalvar
36, Ultimate Gameplay: Elven Magic Items by Johnathan M. Richards
40, A Whole New Rogue by John Thompson
44, Confessions of a Session Amnesiac by Jonny Nexus
46, ICQA Field Test #5504: Tak Industries Brimstone Rocket by August Hahn
50, Conan: Roleplaying in the Hyborian Age by Ian Sturrock
56, Now You See It? Now You Don't by Joseph Miller
62, Showdown in Kazakhstan by August Hahn

93438.name: MLB 07: The Show
videogamehonor: 2008 D.I.C.E. Sports Game of the Year Nominee
93438.description:
MLB 07: The Show, produced by SCE San Diego Studio, is a baseball video game for PlayStation 3, PlayStation 2 and PSP. It is the only first-party MLB-licensed video game for the 2007 season, and the only baseball game available for the PlayStation systems aside from Major League Baseball 2K7. For this reason, it is likely to draw attention to the brand and franchise, while the top selling baseball video game developers of previous seasons, notably EA Sports, are forced to devise creative alternatives. The PlayStation 2 and the PSP versions of this game were released on February 27, 2007 while the PlayStation 3 version was released on May 15, 2007.

New York Mets 2007 All-Star third baseman David Wright is featured on the cover. The three-man team of announcers once again include Rex Hudler, Matt Vasgersian and Dave Campbell.

Source: Wikipedia, "MLB 07: The Show", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

93439.name: Blast Lacrosse
93439.description:
Blast Lacrosse is an indoor lacrosse video game released on May 23, 2001 for Sony's PlayStation. It is officially licensed by and based on the National Lacrosse League and includes all nine teams of their 15th season, including mascots. It is also licensed by the Professional Lacrosse Players' Association. The game features in-game advertisements for Shamrock Lacrosse and STX. The cover features an Ottawa Rebel player wearing #88.

The style of play is very similar to the arcade style of NBA Jam and NFL Blitz where, if a player scores a hat trick they become "on fire" and play better until stopped.

The game is voiced by play-by-play man, and sports radio host, Scott Ferrall.
